Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lara_V2012
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 3 nights and we will definitely return. The location was close to everything - good restaurants, cafe's, shopping, taxi rank. The service was outstanding with staff recommending good restaurants, recommending and booking our show & rivercruise and completing our on-line flight check-in for us. The room wasn't huge, but certainly big enough. Great attention to detail in the decor...it felt like Paris should!!, it was spotless and the bed really comfortable. The bathroom was better than other 3 star hotels (even some 4 star hotels) we have stayed at before. The only negative experience would have been that I couldn't have an iron & ironing board in my room (due to safety reasons they said, not something I've come across before and we travel a lot), and the ironing lady had already left for the day. I'll just remember to bring my travel iron next time as we will most definitely return. Thanks for the beautiful memories :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Serene S
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay, good location many places to eat, near the Metro, and shopping area. The rooms are large, with a large bathroom and very comfortable bed. The morning breakfast has a large selection of food that is wonderfully prepared, and the coffee was excellent. Service in the hotel was excellent, and was able to get an hour late check out as my flight was late that afternoon. I highly recommend this as a place to stay while in Paris, located 5 minutes by taxi to most of the main sightseeing sights. I look forward to staying there again on my next business trip to Paris or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff and ideal location !!”
Reviews.Author: New121
Reviews.Content: We stayed there as 8 adults in couples all extremely happy with our choice of hotel , location was great close by to restaurants and bars! Staff were lovely and very helpful all 3 of the ones we saw!!

Reviews.Title: “Great girls weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cosmiccaro
Reviews.Content: I stayed here mid March 2012 with 3 other girls (all in our early 20s) and we all had a great time. We had 2 traditional rooms, which were small but spotless and very well designed. The beds were comfortable and clean. The bathroom was a decent size with a good shower and a small cabinet which was handy to keep all your toiletries in (especially with 2 girls sharing!) The wardrobe was much bigger than most Paris hotels I’ve stayed in and there were plenty of mirrors. We also had a nice view over Paris rooftops from our window- which looked even better as we got clear blue skies and sunshine throughout our stay. I have been to Paris many times before and stayed in the Latin Quarter the most as I think it’s the nicest area of Paris. The hotel is named as Saint Germain, but it is definitely closer to Montparnasse, not that this is a bad thing. I have never stayed here and would definitely go back, plenty of restaurants, nice shops and good travel links to the rest of the city. You don’t lose any of the charm of the Saint Germain area. The hotel was very quiet, it has no bar or restaurant etc. But you can get all that in the surrounding area anyway. The staff were fine, not rude, but not overly nice. We didn’t pay for the breakfast, so I can’t comment on that, but the breakfast room was lovely. There are plenty of places nearby to grab a croissant or bread roll. The Aviatic provides a great base to come back to sleep and get ready for the day- all you want from a city hotel! I would definitely recommend the hotel to friends and family and it was great for a group of young girls because the area felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Aviatic”
Reviews.Author: Idun S
Reviews.Content: We were a group of about 15 who stayed at Aviatic Hotel for a few nights in connection with a committee meeting in Paris. We were given the recently renovated rooms which were small, but very nicely decorated and practical. The location is great, close to the metro and within walking distance of many great sights. The staff was incredibly helpful and accommodated all requests while we were there. I would recommend this hotel both for business and pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tgepee
Reviews.Content: This beautify Hotel is ideally situated in the latin Quarter of Paris. With friendly staff and a lovely atmosphere it combines to create an excellent base to visit this beautiful city either for leisure or romance. Excellent location for cafes, restaurants and the metro system.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel with helpful staff and a good location in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: katiekeating
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aviatic Hotel Saint Germain for 1 night, on the recommendation of a friend. We booked directly with the hotel and recieved a significantly discounted rate for advance purchase, as well as detailed directions to the find the hotel with the booking. The hotel is located close to a Gare Montparnasse and walking distance to the Tour Eiffel and many other attractions in Paris. We stayed in a double room, which was smallish, but clean, modern and quiet. The front desk staff at the hotel all spoke English and were very helpful. Overall, the Aviatic Hotel Saint Germain is a charming hotel with helpful staff and a good location in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: SharonC1807
Reviews.Content: I don't usually bother to comment on hotels or staff but I really felt that our short Parisienne adventure was made all the more enjoyable with the aid of very helpful staff at the Aviatic. They provided accurate information so we could make the best use of our time to visit the places we wanted to see. The hotel is in a great location near to a variety of different cafes. Rooms were very comfortable, smart and clean. Sharon C. Surrey. England

Reviews.Title: “tiny but expected for Paris”
Reviews.Author: CamdenSF
Reviews.Content: This place is located in a great area, close to tons of restaurants and good transportation. A bit far if you are walking with your luggage from the train coming from the airport. Well, that is if you pack like me and not my husband ;). As I mentioned, the rooms are tiny but that is expected for Paris. More importantly they are very clean, breakfast is good and the service is very friendly and helpful. Great price too after several comparisons.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annika M
Reviews.Content: This hotel more than met our expectations. The atmosphere of the hotel was very nice and the location was super. The staff was very helpful and the interior very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kevyt
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff who went beyond the call. They helped me out with some arrangements for my partners birthday and nothing was a problem.The rooms are larger than you would normally get in Paris, in fact they're positively huge!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: T O
Reviews.Content: My family and I rented two rooms here for five nights, and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The front office staff was very polite and helpful, and they were a pleasure to chat with. The (included in the price) breakfast was more than adequate, although the breakfast room was a bit crowded and hot (if everyone were there at the same time). Loved the coffee machine though! I was able to be fully caffeinated before starting my day. Our two rooms were quite different in decor and lighting. The full size bed for two was very well lit, with a decent sized bathroom. Our room which slept three was a bit darker, and would have loved a bit more light over the head of the bed to read, but only a minor issue. Could have used another open plug or two, but all-in-all a very nice room. Wine in the room was reasonably priced as well. Rooms were quite clean and tasteful. Location is certainly within walking distance to the main sights, but is a bit of a walk (which I like to do). When we didn't want to walk, the metro was only a block away (around the corner), so was quite convenient, although unless you had a refillable pass, you will need to purchase at a different station. Plenty of nice restaurants nearby, with a large shopping mall only a block or two away. Overall, was quite happy with our stay at Aviatic, and would definitely entertain staying here on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all but location”
Reviews.Author: patrickm123
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because, on this occasion, we needed secure parking for a heavily loaded car and there were very few choices offering this. However, it proved a very good – and good value – discovery. The only slight downside was the location. When arriving by Eurostar, we usually stay in the heart of St Germain, which is a rather dull ten or fifteen minutes walk away from the Aviatic (the long Rue Vaugirard being particularly bleak), so we used the metro much more than usual (buying the so-called “Mobilis” day passes, so that we didn’t have to worry how many journeys we made). This aside, we were delighted with the stay. For a start, the online non-refundable room rate of 170 Euros which we paid for a superior category room was roughly half what we might otherwise have paid for hotels nearer Saint Germain and both the room and the twin beds were larger than we have typically known, with excellent mattresses and duvets. The double glazing was very effective in blocking street noises and the (relatively rare in France) fact that the air-conditioning was still usable in winter made it easy to regulate the temperature without opening windows. The decor cleverly combined modern fabrics and materials with a period feel appropriate to the building. Sheets and towels were changed daily and the bathroom products generously topped up. The bath (in room 134) was really too small to be used as such, but the shower above it was vigorous, if hard to adjust. The breakfast buffet (14 Euros) managed to cram a large range of choices into a very small serving area. The freshly made coffees from the machine were excellent, as were the breads, jams (perhaps homemade – certainly served as though they were), compôtes and pastries. There were also yoghurts, cold meats and cheeses, which we didn’t try. As others have noted, though, the breakfast room is tiny, making it hard to squeeze through to the buffet, when the room is busy. No doubt to ease the pressure, the hotel offers a simpler breakfast in the rooms at 8 Euros, but the furniture in our room didn’t really lend itself to this. The reception staff were helpful with restaurant confirmations and the like; and generous touches included the complimentary bottle of red Bordeaux in the room and the “help-yourself” carafes of wine and nibbles in the hallway in the evenings (though, sadly, the white wine proved undrinkable!). The garage accommodation was an individual lock-up inside the parking area (itself also locked) for a block of flats on the opposite side of the road, so total piece of mind. Quite tight, however, for a largish car, so check this when you book the parking. (I think the hotel has two of these spaces.) All in all, if the prices remain keen, we may well switch our allegiance for future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Belleblossom
Reviews.Content: I just came home after a stay at the Aviatic, and I am very pleased. Where to start.. One of the best things about the hotel is the decor/interiour. Even though it is just a three-star, you get the feeling that this hotel is a more exclusive three-star. In fact, it reminded me of a four-star I stayed on a while ago... And seriously, there are a lot of ugly three-stars out there, so watch out! The housekeeping was excellent. The cleaned or room every single day, brought us fresh towels and arranged or belongings so that everything looked spotless when we came home from shopping all day. SO nice!. Other that that I loved the fact that you could order french breakfast in the room for only 8€! Smooth! The receptionists also did an excellent job.. As to the location, I would say the the hotel is closer to Montparnasse than Saint Germain. Well, well. As we have been to Paris many times, using the metrosystem is easypeasy, and there are several stations not far from the hotel. Funny: - Some people stated that the rooms were small. To that I have to say: "Have you ever been in Paris? Rooms are small. End of story! If you want a bigger room, pay up!" Same goes for elevators. - But you know, you just got to love the tiny elevators. They're simply French! All in all this is a hotel I would recommend to my friends. A great choice in a city with so many hotels! M.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - my issues may be with Paris hotels in general?”
Reviews.Author: JVernonNg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on our Europe trip this spring. In general, my wife and I thought it a good little hotel, and a great "home base" to explore Paris. Pros: - Good location, about a half-mile walk from the Metro and close to a decent number of restaurants/cafes - Nice service. They all spoke English, they were helpful about currency exchange, cab, train, and restaurant recommendations. - Cleanliness Cons: - Room bathroom and shower bathroom (they're separate) are tiny. A tall person will struggle a little bit. Perhaps this is true for all Paris hotels in general? - Electrical - you had to leave a room card/key in a slot on the wall to power the room's electricity. This makes it a little problematic if you're trying to charge an electronics device during the day. - Beds - the beds were actually two full beds pushed together, but they kept sliding apart, letting one of us fall through the separation during the middle of the night. All in all, it was a great location, and you can't go wrong with St Germain in Paris. We would definitely consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Johnsonwax
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a very enjoyable short break to Paris. The hotel is in a very good position, with lots of restaurants close by and we walked to most places and we did not have a difficulty with this. Our room was lovely. We had 2 windows and the room was quite large. Obviously cannot comment on the other rooms that have been mentioned on TA as being very small. The staff were so helpful and friendly. We had breakfast in the hotel on the first day but after that we ate out to have a bit more choice but the breakfast is adequate. We love small, boutique hotels and this hotel fits the bill and we would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “VIVE LE AVIATIC PER OLD CUSTOMER”
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: The Aviatic is s jewel. Some of their long-time staff even remembers us from our 6 or 7 visits over the past 20 years. The multi-lingual staff will assist guests in bookings and advice. They are polite, helpful, and knowledgeable. The rooms, though typically small, are clean and recently redecorated. The Aviatic is a walk from Mt. Parnesse RR station---the major station in Paris for the 'bullet trains". It's about 3 blocks to the metro---or a long walk---to Fountain Blue, St. Germaine, Latin Quarter, and Isle de Cite. It's an ideal location. Prices are very reasonable. Choose the breakfast plan. It's the cheapest breakfast with plenty to eat. Bill and Sandy Haddad

Reviews.Title: “So, So”
Reviews.Author: Sparr0w47
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stay here for 3 nights in October. Location of hotel is about 200 meters from Montparnasse metro station. Hotel is very clean and tidy obviously recently had a face lift. We had a "standard room". It was tastefully decorated and we could not fault the cleanliness. Bathroom was lovely. However, room was very small - literally not enough room to swing the proverbial cat! Very claustrophobic. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Didn't go down to breakfast (14 Euros is a bit steep for coffee and cake!) also the breakfast room was tiny and once half a dozen or so people were in there it was full! Location? Not a lot in the immediate vicinity. Would we go there again? Probably not....

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel was a nice hotel & stay”
Reviews.Author: SimonPSurrey
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to Paris countless times and over the years the hotel prices have crept up and up and for the quality you pay goes down and down. I was in Paris recently and had a terrible 3 star..so its a bit hit and miss, so I was really pleased with the choice of stay at the Aviatic Hotel The location is fine about 5mins from the Montparnasse Tower - station, taxi's etc.. restaurants all around you, a busy(ish) road but not like the madness in places in Paris. The hotel although small was really well laid out and the reception area made it feel like a 4star compared to being a 3star. The lift was as ever in Paris small, the standard room was all be it small.. for the hotel it was fine... a 2nd night yes fine also but i'd think for a few days more then it would have been uncomfortable.... The breakfast room was well laid out, and a decent range of usuals... and great coffee. I would have no doubts staying here again...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Attila M
Reviews.Content: The location and staff are excellent (the receptionist did speak even Hungarian) the room a bit small but overall comfortable. The Hotel is a good starting point for city trips, we enjoyed staying there. We had a very good stay in Paris, nothing wrong to be said about the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: wjmonteiro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great choice if you are looking for a quiet place near the main attractions in Paris and very close to more than one subway stations. I went there with my wife to celebrate our 25 wedding anniversary. The Staff are very friendly and always there to help you on your needs. The rooms are awesome. Breakfast is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: robandsue51
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from the Eurostar website. It's in a fairly quiet road, but very close to busy streets and all main sights (Eiffel Tower, Grand Palais, Invalides, Monparnasse Tower) were walkable. Our room was away from any street noise and we were able to sleep with the window open at night. It was one of the smaller "tradition" rooms, recently refurbished and had air conditioning, a very comfortable bed, a large shower and plenty of clothes hanging space. Not much of a view, but worth trading that for tranquillity. Sheets and towels were changed daily. Staff were very friendly, especially after it was clear we spoke reasonable French. Breakfasts were reasonably comprehensive (meusli, fruit, bread, plus usual French items) and we especially liked the packed lunch that we asked for on one of our days there.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Judith W
Reviews.Content: The Aviatic is a very pleasant, friendly place to stay. The reception staff were extremely helpful and accomodating in all ways. In particular Fanny was delightful. The hotel itself is just about 10 minutes walk too far from our main shopping targets in Paris, but the foyer, the decoration and flowers were always lovely and the beds extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chrysaphiades
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to Montparnasse rail station and the subway which was important for us during our stay in Paris. On arrival we were greeted with genuine warm smiles and staff who spoke English very proficiently. It is clear to see that the original building has been beautifully restored and retains many authentic features. Our rooms were well equipped, clean and well presented. We have three young kids and had interconnecting rooms. The beds were very comfortable and whilst our stay was brief we would certainly consider this hotel for longer stays in Paris. We have no hesitation in our recommendation of this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kate n
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely helpful - the well-furnished rooms and lobby were definitely appreciated! We were greeted with a complimentary bottle of wine for our room and enjoyed their complimentary happy hours each evening (just a little table with wine / snacks in the lobby but it was nice!) Great value and very well situated - close to a metro (5 minutes walk) - lots of restaurants (great, neighborhood-y spots) - and close to a Gallerie Lafayette! Loved our stay and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KurtM573
Reviews.Content: Great value. This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. Service was excellent. Clean and well decorated rooms. Great location near a metro station. If you are going to Paris on holiday, I would definately recommend the Paris museum pass. It is about break even on cost, but it gets you to the front of the line. It saved us an hour at the Louvre alone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Raganella78
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights at this hotel. The room was clean, cosy, quiet, confortable and well organized (not big but not even too small). Receptionists were friendly and helpful. It is located in a safe and quiet area, with many brasseries and cafè. Just outside Duroc Metro station you can find a very good boulangerie where you can have breakfast (we had made an advance reservation at a very discounted rate and breakfast was not included). The hotel is closed to two metro stations (5 lines) so you can easily rich major attractions. I would absolutely suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mora G
Reviews.Content: The Aviatic Hotel is in a great location in Paris; the area around Saint Germain is vibrant, interesting and within easy access of all the main attractions. The hotel itself is positioned on a quiet section of the Rue de Vaugirard and our room, number 141 at the back of the hotel , was very quiet. The room was beautifully furnished and stylishly decorated with a comfortable bed and attractive mosaic-tiled bathroom. We had a bath and a very efficient shower and the towelling robes were an unexpected extra. When we arrived, we were told that the room we had booked - a standard room - was unavailable and we had been given an upgrade at no extra cost. This generous gesture was the first of many examples of helpfulness shown by the hotel staff. They were, without exception, helpful, friendly and polite and all spoke very good English. Whenever we needed advice about restaurants,ordering taxis and finding buses they were extremely helpful and efficient. (Ask at reception about the bus stop for the number 95 bus - it's a couple of minutes away and is very useful for getting to many of the main sights.) The hotel breakfast was excellent - croissants, pastries (try the chocolate and custard pastry!), different breads and baguettes,macaroons, hard-boiled eggs, cheese, meats, fresh fruit salad, fruit compotes, freshly-squeezed juices, cereals, yogurts, jams and a variety of hot drinks. An added advantage was the hotel lift - after a day walking round Paris, walking up the stairs to the 4th floor wasn't an appealing prospect! In conclusion, I would describe the Aviatic Hotel as a stylish, welcoming hotel that is full of Parisian charm. It is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at and feels more like a four star hotel than a three star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RenataEggplant
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel , good location in a quiet street. Close to metro, touristic bus stops and good restaurants. Very very good service , all attendants speak English and always willing to help. Got an upgrade for free! Free wi-fi internet included, ver handy. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled1950
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant Hotel .Staff very helpful. Convenient to most sights ,a short walk or a few minutes on the bus or metro .Has a lift so no dragging cases up tight stairways.Recently renovated to high standard. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy, would go back”
Reviews.Author: atcross
Reviews.Content: Polite, friendly staff, lovely room. Smallish room, but pleasant and clean, perfect for a couple for a few days. Would stay again, very good value for money, been in more expensive places for not nearly as nice a stay. Area is near lots of restaurants and metro, walking distance for most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, will definitely use again”
Reviews.Author: rscolins
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Aviatic, and if anything had changed other than the staff, we couldn't tell. The room was spotless, the service was excellent, the staff was knowledgeable and helpful (and fluent in English), and the location was within walking distance of many attractions and two different Metro stations. The rooms are small, with a chair only at the desk, but this was not an issue for us as we spent most of our time out and about. There is a small lounge off the lobby with seating for four people (one sofa and two chairs) with additional random seating around the lobby. The dining room is only for breakfast (self-serve coffee, tea, bread and pastries, cereal, yogurt, cold meats, hard-boiled eggs) but has a coffee/hot chocolate/hot water machine available outside breakfast hours at 2 euros per serving. There are several small restaurants/cafes with excellent food and service within a short walking distance. I have no other experience with Paris 3 star hotels, but I cannot imagine one being better for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Charming!”
Reviews.Author: JanandSergio
Reviews.Content: Easy to get around location, wonderful staff, charming decor, very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: digimom98
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights and had a wonderful visit. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast very good. Lots of restaurants close by. Short walk to the Metro. On a semi-quiet side street. Rooms clean. Free Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dogwood382
Reviews.Content: My children and I stayed for 7 nights, the hotel was clean, very quiet, had all the amenities we needed. The location is wonderful with the underground station only a block away, many restaurants within a 2-minute walk. The staff - from reception to cleaning - were all very happy and concerned that we had everything we needed. They took very good care of us and I will be very happy to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff were very friendly and super helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Mikem5052
Reviews.Content: Hotel is small and friendly. Rooms are a bit small but well equipped and prices are fair for Paris. Staff was very professional and went out of their way to help with all our needs (thanks Jean). Nice extra touches like free wine in the lobby before dinner. Breakfast was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, quaint, fabulous service - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: dee_travels_together
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2010. Our trip had been a very eventful one over 5 weeks and Paris was our last stop so our expectations were high. We weren't disappointed with this gorgeous hotel. Our room was great - reasonable size for Paris, comfortable beds & sheets, clean bathroom, and lovely little bathroom soap/ shampoo/ moisturisers! Location was quite good, in the 6th arrondissement, within walking distance to restaurants and shops in Montparnasse and around a 5 minute walk to the metro. The decor throughout the hotel was pretty and thoughtful, and the breakfast (not included) was above average. The highlight for us was when one of us was suddenly struck down with appendicitis (the day before we were due to leave for home) and sent to hospital. While dealing with the stress of communicating a health issue in a strange country, getting trusted treatment, insurance companies, new travel arrangements, and cashflow strain, the wonderful staff at the hotel could not have been more supportive. They provided translation assistance, flexibility for our ongoing booking, and a reassuring smile or listening ear when they were all needed most. If we ever return to Paris, we'd love to stay here again. We can't recommend them highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dhoyle
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room over the street, with a comfortable bed, windows that opened, and a good bathroom. However, at one end of the room where one would expect to find a couple of reading chairs (as shown on the web site), there was a narrow bed. A couple of throw cushions suggested it could also be used as a day bed, but it was not comfortable for sitting. Also, we could not get wifi reception in the room on our computer or iPhone, and had to go down to the lobby to use it. So, without a comfortable place to sit and read, or the opportunity to work on the Internet in the room, it became just a place to sleep - disappointing. The staff is brusque rather than friendly, and I never felt they made any effort beyond the necessary to be helpful. We've stayed in much warmer, friendlier and more helpful hotels in Paris. Time to go back to them...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying local culture”
Reviews.Author: syaad
Reviews.Content: What I love about this hotel is that its located in the middle of Parisian daily lives. School kids, working people and family pass by this area. I can get a glimpse of their culture. Room decorations are chic. Simple and clean hotel. Nothing too fancy service, just simple. Locations are good too, easy access everywhere. Restaurant, metro, shops nearby. Reccomend restaurant by the corner, cant remember the name. Great onion soup.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value for money but some things to improve”
Reviews.Author: Antwerpjohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Aviatic Saint Germain hotel in the first weekend of may. The staff was very friendly. The hotel is tastefully decorated and the standard roon where we stayed was rather small but also well decorated and clean. In the bathroom was not enough space around the sink te put cosmetics. The shower was very good. The breakfast was good with good quality products, but the breakfast room was much too small for all the guests. The coffee from the self-service coffee machine wasn't good and had a taste of chocolate milk. The hotel is located close to the Momparnasse tower where you can find a lot of restaurants. This isn't though a location where you can find the picturesque Paris, but there is a metro station close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST OF PARIS !!”
Reviews.Author: VacanceTur
Reviews.Content: Were on honeymoon in Paris on 19 to april 23.....and this hotel will be in our memory as an unforgettable experience of Paris . The hotel is perfect... all staff are always happy and pass a image of Paris, the more romantic city of the world.... a big hug for mrs Frederiqueé... We loves you... Milton Filho and Mayara Barros

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Aviatic St. Germain was a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Doreenb3121121
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recently renovated. The rooms are clean, pleasant to the eye, and just the right size for Europe! The main lobby, sitting room, and cafe are all nicely decorated and very relaxing. Great breakfast in the cafe! The staff was friendly and very accomodating! The shower was fantastic for Europe!! Great water pressure and hot water every day, all day! The beds and pillows were very comfortable. We would highly recommend this hotel, and would very definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and a great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: meglara
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 1 week in May 2011. We chose it based on other reviews and were not disappointed. The location couldn't be better. We had access within steps of the hotel to all major metro stations (be sure to get your 3 or 5 day metro pass) which we used non stop. There were also a great variety of shops, bistros and restaurants, as well as banks (HSBC on the corner). Our room was great. We stayed in room 142 (Prestige Room Type). The entrance, room & bathroom were all a good size and had everything we needed. The bed was a comfortable king size, clean and ample bedding. There bathroom had a proper sized bath shower combo, toilet and sink and were all clean. There was a desk, bar fridge in a cabinet, and a decent sized closet with hangers and a safe. The room had two large windows that opened with a great view of the street/neighbourhood. The breakfast was great with everything you need to get you going for long days of walking & sightseeing. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel had free wifi as well as an internet station with pay per usage which was always ready to use. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone of any age looking for a great location with comfortable, frinedly and most important, clean accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value hotel that's recommended!”
Reviews.Author: jamesclau
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here last week and found everything to be very good. We came very early in the morning and the staff helped us stow away our luggage and showed us where to go and we were on our way. We came back around 1 or 2 and the room was comfortable, not small at all by Paris standards. It was very clean, we had a small sitting area along with a spacious washroom and a comfortable double bed. Location was great and it was a 3 minute walk to a couple of different metros and we rarely had to change lines to get to our destinations. Would definitely recommend again and for the value (cost) of the hotel, it was a superb deal!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul924
Reviews.Content: The Aviatic Hotel St. Germain is an excellent choice for a stay in Paris. The hotel and rooms are exceptionally clean and well maintained. This is a boutique hotel which adds to the charm of the residence. The staff, morning, afternoon-evening and weekends are to be commended for their positive and helpful attitude. The location is superb.... near Metro stops, stores and cafes. This is a very safe and walkable area both day and night. The room we stayed in was on the top floor and it was very quiet. There is no street noise. Do consider this hotel for your stay. You'll enjoy the complimentary wine each evening in the lobby area. Enjoy a glass or two in the sitting area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but subway is directly under - noise issues.”
Reviews.Author: lifefullcolor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is re-done with a lot of thought and care, and the staff is helpful, but the location right over a subway line means a rumbling noise until they stop at 1 or 2 am, and then starting again at 6am. I was on the third floor, and had a rough time. Unless you're a skilled sleeper, I think this little hotel is just too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and quiet”
Reviews.Author: bmackenz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aviatic St. Germain for four nights and it was delightful. The decor was charming...very Marie Antoinette. The room was very clean and attractive. We were on the courtyard so it was very quiet at night. The room was small but but we preferred the quiet of the courtyard. Our friends had a larger room on the street side. ( They said there wasn't much traffic noise though) The staff was very helpful and spoke several languages very well. A lovely pastery, meat, cheese, cereal and fruit breakfast was included. In the evening, carafes of wine were put out in the lobby for guests to have a glass while they make their plans for the evening or waiting for the rest of your party. Close to public trasportation, shopping and some lovely cafe's. It was a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “I would not come back to this place.”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlhk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just last week and it was my first visit to Paris. First of all, note that this hotel is located in the Montparnasse area (14e) despite being marketed as in the St. Germain area (6e). The address is technically 6th district but it is really part of the Montparnasse district, which is touristy and not the charming 6th district, which is what I expected. However, it is close to 2 subway stations and therefore easy for you to get around. The facilities are nice. The rooms are small but cozy and the bathrooms were very clean. It is the service that I have a complaint about, and which has turned me off from considering going back or recommending this place. To summarize, the staff is indifferent and unhelpful. When my Air France shuttle bus (as recommended by their website) wouldn't come, I thought to call the hotel concierge for some tips. They simply said, the bus is quicker than the subway. Full stop. After over an hour of waiting, I then decided there was no option other than the train, and so 4.5 hours later, I finally got to this hotel. When I got there there were, I had to wait a good while before any of the staff members even bothered looking at me and greeting me. When I checked out, I asked for a a late check out and they said it was impossible. I then asked for a 30minute extension and they said, "no more than that." Throughout my stay, I cannot say that they are rude per se, as they are usually courteous. But the courtesy is insincere and cold. They are impersonal and unhelpful. I had read somewhere that this place has been running for over 100 years and so, was expecting some friendliness -- I found zero. I had very little expectation of service in France to begin with, but this place really exceeded my expectations, in the reverse direction. In retrospect, I would have preferred to have stayed at a hostel where it would have been much cheaper and where at least I would have found some friendliness from staff or other travelers. I am very sorry I chose this hotel on my first trip to Paris as it certainly left a sour taste in my mouth and put a damper on my impression of this beautiful city. If you are looking for a clean place to stay with easy access to subways (but not the best area), this may be the place for you. If you are looking for charm and service from a hotel, I do not recommend the Aviatic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: vb80
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, all the staff were very nice, welcoming and helpful. The building is lovely and our room was very nice and extremely clean and also a little quirky! It was quite an odd shape but for us that added to the appeal, it was not a square box like so many other hotels I have stayed in. The bed was very comfy and the room had everything that was required including a fridge (mini bar) and a safe. We had a room on the second floor, the window looked out to an internal courtyard, perhaps not the best view but pleasant enough and we didn't go to Paris to sit in the room and look out the window so it didn't bother us in the slightest!! The location is very good, its on a quiet part of the street so there is no noise at night but it is just round the corner from lots of bars and restaurants and a supermarket. There is a main metro station just a couple of minutes walk away from which you can easily travel to anywhere in the centre. The metro system in Paris is very good and pretty cheap but you can also walk to quite a lot of places from the hotel which was our preffered method of travel so we could see more of Paris! The hotel offered free wine and nibbles in the evening in the lobby which was a nice touch and we enjoyed a glass on a couple of evenings. I'm not sure what time this started at but seemed to finish at 10pm. Overall we were very happy with this hotel and would definately return if and when we go to Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: mevaWisconsin
Reviews.Content: great location, great staff, very quaint hotel. This was the cleanest hotel I have been in in europe with remarkably comfortable beds. The location was excellent and the staff was very helpful. All spoke english/french with addition of spainish/portuguese etc.. would highly recommend this hotel to all travelers and I would stay again. I have stayed in a few different hotels in paris and this was by far the nicest at a reasonable cost

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneBusyMum
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel with my son. Staff were helpful and the room was lovely (small like most rooms in Paris but very well appointed and nicely decorated). A lovely touch was a complimentary bottle of wine in the room upon our arrival. Free wifi very much appreciated. Location good, a couple of blocks from the metro and easy to get to the main sights. Overall a very pleasant experience and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Acti0nMan
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, booking us reservations in hotels, and generally very knowledgable and spoke good english. Room was tastefully decorated and clean, couldn't have asked for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Joanna_Ivan
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful staff! Cleanliness was excellent, the location - perfect - the hotel is near to 5 metro stations! The rooms are small,but very cute and well decorated! If you are going on a romantic trip with your partner I definitely recommend this hotel! Also there is free wi-fi, which is great! About the value of money- It isn`t cheap, but in my opinion it`s worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good price, good location - would definiately return”
Reviews.Author: Saria88London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aviatic Hotel for 3 nights in one single room and a twin, both with ensuites. The staff all spoke excellent English and were very helpfull and polite, happy to give us directions and advice about travel etc. There was a mix up when we first arrived as we had been allocated a double instead of a twin - not ideal as I was sharing with my mum! However, the man checking us in was very apologetic and quickly arranged another room, so no real problem. They were happy to accommodate our luggage the morning we checked out, with included a painting we had not yet found a cardboard tube for and they made sure it didn't get buckled or squashed. The rooms were both great - very clean and nicely decorated. The beds and pillows were comfy and the bathrooms a nice size (the single had a shower and the twin had a bath with a shower). I thought the breakfast was overpriced - but then I think that most hotel breakfasts are, so comparatively it was probably about average - but it was nice. A good selection: cereals, toast, croissants, baguette, cold meats, yogart, hot drinks, a choice of juices... The hotel is in a good location - only 10 mins from Montparnasse station and only a short walk to several Metro stations. Although it is close to the road, the hotel was very quiet, we were not disturbed at all. Overall a very good hotel, one I would definately return to.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, friendly staff and excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Ivail0
Reviews.Content: I would return, if possible! Very good location, near metro station and other transport. Rooms are a litlle bit smaller than expected, but are clean and cosy. You may feel the Paris in this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Would Return”
Reviews.Author: travelpartout
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly located to get around Paris, it was clean but small. The staff were helpful and hopefully the life has been fixed and renovations finished by now that will only enhance this lovely little find. A little too hot in rooms and breakfast was not included but head out and grab something on the move to avoid their prices. Despite that I would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service, would not recommend to friends or family!”
Reviews.Author: ks1547
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my sister, initially we were very happy, the location is very close to a key Metro stop (the Metro was very easy to navigate and took us everywhere!), the accomodations were nice, but we had a few issues that left a negative impression on our overall trip, the worst occurred just as we were checking out, we had requested a shuttle to the airport a few days before our departure, the front desk took our flight info and reassured us it was all arranged, but the morning of our flight we discovered that nothing was booked, it was too late to get a shuttle, so we had to get a taxi which cost at least 20 euro more, the amount was not as important as the fact that the hotel took no responsibility, no apology, the employee just stated that he would ask his colleague what happened... terrible customer service, I was shocked that they didn't even offer to cover the difference for the cab ride or offer a taxi voucher. Even worse, after we returned home, the hotel manager did email us to apologize and offer to cover the cost of the taxi, but then we never heard back from them, we waited for several months checking visa statements for a refund that never came, we even told him that he didn't have to worry about covering the entire taxi bill but just the difference from the shuttle... there were a couple of other minor issues, but this was the main one that I felt important to share with other travellers. I would definitely not recommend staying here, there were several hotels in the same area that looked nice and I've also heard from others that renting apartments is a good option too, especially if travelling with a bigger group/family. Paris is a great city and I will definitely visit again in future, just not stay at the Aviatic Saint Germain!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: marieauQuebec
Reviews.Content: very good location, near montparnasse train station and subway, nice neighbourhood. The hotel is located in a quiet street, and the service is perfect. The room are small, but what expect from a paris hotel. The room we had was fully renovated, with big shower, italian style. We obtained very good prices using expedia, so don't hesitate to spend some days at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “New Year Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jimmywhite61
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the staff at the Aviatic, especially Paolo, his courtesy and professionalism was greatly appreciated. The Hotel was charming, and centrally located. We were able to walk to almost every location we wanted. Thank you for making our getaway and New Year an experience to remember. Abiento James

Reviews.Title: “Third time... and it was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Cramond07
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that we stay in this hotel. This time the whole experience was fantastic. The new rooms are amazing. We ask for an upgrade to the Prestige Rooms and it was awesome. Bathroom perfect and the room for Paris standard was big with a beautiful design. They received us with a bottle of wine in the room. The wi-fi was free and at reception they always have wines and snacks!!!! Front desk was very helpful and very nice, always with good humor. At check out, they didn´t charge us some calls we made. And for New Years, they had some delicious chocolate for us... a really nice touch. The only thing that we didn´t love was the breakfast express. It was very small and really... nothing special. But that´s nothing comparing with the great experience that you have when staying here. For this hotel the line "In all the details there is God" works perfectly for this hotel. Great experiencia. Would return in a second! Do not think twice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, stay and price”
Reviews.Author: lovemyrescues
Reviews.Content: Terrific location in Paris with a very clean room and pleasant staff. The room is on the small side but adequate for a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with Character and Personality”
Reviews.Author: FACEtrip
Reviews.Content: It doesn't look like much from the outside, but the interior is well kept, cozy and clean. The entrance lobby offers a comfortble sitting room, and a cafè style breakfast room. Complimentary snacks and drinks (aperitif) are offered in the early evening. The hotel staff were always helpful and friendly. The elevator is limited, don't travel with large suitcases. The rooms, although small, are nicely decorated with wood floors and designer wallpaper. The bathroom was spacious and seemed to be newly renovated. We were on the 5th floor facing the street but we didn't hear street noise at all. We were travelling with other family members that had to be moved because of technical promblems but this didn't seem to blemish their opinon of the service, in fact the staff were very helpful. The location is excellent, very near Duroc and Montparnasse metro. You can walk up Rue Rennes to Saint Germain area there are many restaurants and shopping in the area. Yes, we will most probably stay here again. Yes, we would reccomend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: satnavigator
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Paris in August 2010 for a business trip, accompanied wih my wife. After reviewing Trip Advisor recommendation, we decided to stay at Aviatic Hotel. The hotel is situated in the midst of Montparnasse quarter, close to the Tour de Montparnasse, and a few steps from Gare de Montparnasse and a couple of Metro stations. Aviatic Hotel is an a quiet street, still surrounded by numerous and live restaurants, reasonably priced concerning it is Paris. Standard hotel room was of moderate size, and completely sufficient for our purposes. The bathroom was of proper size. The room was decorated decently and originally. Pleasant colours made smoothing, cosy and relaxing experience. Everything was very clean, and the cleaning was conducted regularly every day. Along with the excellent and quiet location, and above-average cleanliness, we found the staff to be the hidden treasure of this hotel. People at the reception were extremely helpful, while at the same time being polite and descreet. Whenever we requested any service or information, they responded fast and with the smile. In addition, their suggestions regarding to visiting places and common practices of staying in Paris were always useful and accurate. Regrettably we do not speak French, but it did not seem to be the problem, since the people at the reception speak an excellent English. They also seemed to be happy with our attempts to produce at least a couple of common French words and phrases. In conclusion, we had an memorable stay in a decent, clean and lovely independent hotel, with very friendly, nice and helpfull staff. On our next visit to Paris, we will definitelly arrange the accommodation at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, chic but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: PattyandMike
Reviews.Content: The room was very small but newly decorated and quite chic. It had a small fridge which was handy for wine and cheese (you're in Paris afterall!). Staff were okay but not terribly helpful, standard for Paris. You had to put your room key in a socket to get the lights to turn on and no one explained that until we went downstairs to tell them that we had no electricity. Location was good, a short walk to a main Metro station that could link you to anywhere. Good restaurants and amenities nearby and on a nice day you can walk to the Eiffel Tower in less than half an hour. Breakfast was lovely but very expensive. We ate there once to enjoy the atmosphere of the pretty breakfast room but for much less than half the price you could eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: heights008
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the staff of the Aviatic, they were so nice and helpful. The hotel is charming and in a good location about a mile from the heavy tourist areas, but still active enough to feel like Paris. There are numerous Metro stops within walking distance too. The room itself was cozy, clean, and stylish. We stayed for seven days, so if the place had problems we never saw them. I would definitely recommend it and would absolutely stay again! A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: paris28
Reviews.Content: We had mixed reviews for this hotel. The decor is charming and modern. The room was a decent size for Paris and we found the internet and breakfast to be very reasonably priced. The part we were not so impressed with were the sheets and towels. They were all very worn. The sheets had stains and holes. We had to have a set replaced. The floor needed a good vacuuming. The staff did not impress us either - as if you were a bother to them. We travel to Paris several times a year and usually have very positive experiences with the staff of most hotels. There are better boutique hotels out there for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for the price in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TLCGolf
Reviews.Content: Room is recently updated. AC worked well. Room was quiet. Room size is decent by Paris standard. Beware: Internet access is additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: The_Hills
Reviews.Content: We had a great week at the Aviatic ... much better than we expected for Paris actually. The reception staff were welcoming and helpful and happy to give restaurant recommendations and general advice. Breakfast was good quality and a fair price ... we made use of it for the first few days until we became familiar with the area. All in all we had a great stay ... move it to St Michele and it would be prefect.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good second time around.”
Reviews.Author: DopCornwall
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Aviatic and I have to say if anything it was even better. The option of a small breakfast in your room was perfect. Coffe, bread and juice to start the morning with out the bother of the breakfast room and at only 7e, ideal. The room at the front did suffer slightly from traffic noise but we both slept well once the windows were shut. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Aviatic is a safe and charmingly historic hotel with kind and welcoming staff.”
Reviews.Author: cmend
Reviews.Content: Loved the historic charm of the interior. Clean and comfortable room. The hotel staff was most pleasant and helpful. Thank you, Jean-Marie, and everyone on staff, for the excellent suggestions on places of interest in the neighbourhood (including the great restaurants and cafes). My sister and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Aviatic!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel near Saint-Germain-des-Prés area”
Reviews.Author: innaMontreal
Reviews.Content: Stylish, very clean hotel, with a nice entrance and lounge, lovely fresh flowers at reception and polite, helpful staff. We spent 6 nights in a double room on sixth floor, ours was a cute but tiny room (even for Paris), with a simple but new and spotless bathroom. It was one of their traditional doubles, I had secured it at a hefty discount with full payment in advance through hotel's website. The area is nice, Luxembourg Gardens and St-Germain-des-Prés are near (about a 15 min. walk) and Montparnasse district has its places of interest. Complimentary snacks and wine are offered in the evening, in reception area - a nice touch. A computer with Internet is available for 4 Euros for 15 minutes and 12 Euros(!) for 1 hour. Hotel charges 8 Euros per day for Wi-Fi. I can recommend Joséphine-Chez Dumonet, a good traditional bistro, just a block away at 117 rue du Cherche Midi, and an Éric Kayser bakery with a sitting area, that recently opened nearby, at 1 Boulevard du Montparnasse (open Mon-Sat, 7am-8:30pm).

Reviews.Title: “We spent 10 days here on our Honeymoon and loved it! The people made the difference.”
Reviews.Author: pauli4
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris twice before and new I wanted to stay close to the Latin Quarter. While not situated in the Latin Quarter, it is a very short walk away. The hotel is also close to at least three metro stations, so it's a very good central location to everything. It was my wife's first time there, and she loved it! It was nice to be near the center of the city. The rooms are small but very nice, the bathrooms are clean and have good showers. The room had air conditioning as well. We overpacked and still felt like we had enough room for everything. There is a safe in the closet. The beds were comfortable. Overall, it was quiet and had a lot of charm. After 10 days, it really began to feel like a home away from home for us. What really made this place great was the people. Bruce works at night, he would go out of his way looking things up for us on the internet and suggesting places for us to go/points of interest. The entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Anna works during the day. She is also very sweet and goes the extra mile. Everyone speaks English very well and are more than happy to assist with reservations or recommendations. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Solid Paris 3-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hcharbonnet
Reviews.Content: We just left there today after a 5 night stay - Overall Good Hotel! Staff was very helpul and courteous! Location was very convienent located close to bus routes and some good boutique shopping on Rue de Rennes. Probbaly should be listed as a 4-Star by the hotel rating system, because the other 3-Star hotels we stayed at in Europe did NOT have A/C - Aviatic DID have A/C in all rooms. As well, all employees were fluent in English!!! Some minor things I think need to be noted. (Please note: I am comparing this hotel to American Hotels...) The hotel did not have staff to assist unloading from vehicles or bringing heavy luggage to rooms. As well, internet service was not included in the room - 15euro for 3 days. (Which I know is not typical for Europe Hotels) There were some issues with noise coming from other rooms directly above our room and on our floor. Hallways are very tight and no unused space. Alothough, our room opened to the street on the 4th floor and we never had issues of street noise. #1 Concern - Stay away from the free breakfast. Coffee is out of a machine at the push of a button... which I know is typical for Europe, yet left something to be desired. The one morning we went to the breakfast, the options were not the best and the food that was not spectacular. Nevertheless... we had a magnificant time and the Hotel Aviatic was a very big portion of the our reason for enjoying Paris as much as we did! Like I said... VERY SOLID HOTEL...I would absolutely tell a friend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: abtas
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay at the Aviatic close to Montparnasse and the fantastic cafe dinning that Paris is famous for I found the 3 star rating was hardly fair should be rated 4 star! stay here if you want value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms & great location”
Reviews.Author: jkinney4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and it was great. The location was great we were only a couple of blocks from the Metro and 4 blocks from a great patisserie we stumbled upon. The staff was wonderful; they held our luggage as we toured around Paris for our last day. They even got a taxi for us that was ready when we needed to go out to the airport. The rooms are small (compared to US standards) but are comfortable. Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bohemian chic is affordable in St-Germain for couple with toddler”
Reviews.Author: gennieb
Reviews.Content: We must have searched 30 hotels in the area and this is one of the few hotels who would accommodate for our toddler (everyone else was telling me to get another room). Our room was wonderful; clean, comfortable, quiet, sunny, and spacious for Paris standard. My daughter had a lovely bed to herself and our bed was very plushy. A 10 minute walk to Le Jardin Luxembourg (great playground, poney, rides, and carousel for kids). Five minutes to St-Sulpice and Montparnasse stations. Shopping all around, restaurants... you will not regret this! The staff (especially Bruce) was helpful. I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know. Merci

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: thkl070
Reviews.Content: Aviatic is a great hotel, well located between St. Germain and Montparnasse. The hotel staff is very helpfull. Rooms are clean and decorated very nice . Would defenitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: wartiger
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at the Aviatic. Very close to several metro lines, and never more than a few stops from most of our desired destinations. Nicholas was great and was extremely helpful with dining recommendations, etc. Rooms are small but nicely appointed. Breakfast, which was included, was delightful. We especially enjoyed the complimentary wine in the early evening.

Reviews.Title: “Europe Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethJ55
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and good location. Very helpful staff. Clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good as it seems on the website”
Reviews.Author: tyst
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking, this is a nice hotel, location is okay, not too pricey, staffs are friendly.. but definitely not so good that you can rate it more than 3 stars, or name it a boutique hotel. The other thing that is worth noting is that its breakfast room is very small, you don't want to have breakfast during rush hours, it can be very very crowded. And If you expect to enjoy free wifi, then don't come here.the price is 6 euros per day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LKB113
Reviews.Content: There is one caveat that I would add to anyone who is thinking of booking this hotel. It may be technically in the 6th, but really it's basically in Montparnasse (which is great if you want to take the Metro to Versailles-Chantiers!), which basically means the location, though in central Paris, is a little farther from major sights than most other 3 star hotels in St. Germain (which understandably are much more expensive). That said if you are up for walks, or are taking the metro and don't *have* to be in 10 minute walking distance of the Seine this place is incredible. The decor is this great modern chintz and swag and dark wood mixed with this kind of Japonais theme in the rooms, and Paris cabaret posters in the breakfast room. Small rooms as to be expected - but not tripping over each other. WONDERFUL concierge, decent breakfast (where else is room service less expensive than having to go down to the breakfast room - just great!). Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whitethorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in May. The location of the hotel, though not in th emost exciting area, is quite good. There is a subway and a step on/off tour bus stop just around the corner from the hotel. Reception at the hotel is very good and helpful. All the people at the hotel spoke English and so my feeble attempts at French were unnecessary. The room I stayed in was comfortable, clean and reasonably big for Paris. The hotel is on a quiet street and so there is very little noise at night or the morning. The breakfast is very good and is served in a lovely, if small dining room. Some reviews say the breakfast is expensive at €15, but it could not be got for much less in that area and for the convenience of eating in the hotel, I think it is good value. Plenty of restaurants around the corner from the hote including a very good Italian pizza one. I enjoyed my stay at the Aviatic and could not find fault with it.

Reviews.Title: “great for a single woman”
Reviews.Author: robcanoe
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay and it lived up to my expectations from the first time... great location - easy to get to from Orly airport. Great selection of bistro/restaurants within 10 mins walking. staff really friendly and helpful only negative I have is that I was on a 1st floor room and heard all the water being 'flushed/wahsed away' from the rooms above. however, the location is so good - just 5 mins walk to several metro lines. I almost wish I wasn't telling you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Labeep
Reviews.Content: In April of this year, in the midst of the volcano madness, I spent 3 nights at this hotel. It was a very enjoyable experience. I chose the hotel for the location, between Montparnasse and St. Germain de Pres. You are close to everything but not in the middle of the chaos. The subway stations are 5 minutes away from the hotel (there are several choices). From the corner of the street you can see the Tour Eiffel, beautiful at night. The area is packed with nice restaurants, very affordable, so it is not a problem to grab a bite or a drink. The lobby of the hotel is cozy and warm. There is a small room for breakfast, nicely decorated with old posters. In the evenings, they offer complimentary wine and snacks. Also, another room with a nice fireplace, to sit down while waiting for somebody. You will find too a tiny Internet room, with a MAC computer and printer. To use it, you need to buy prepaid cards at the desk. A tiny elevator takes you to the rooms. I upgraded mine. It wasn’t very big but more than enough for myself and very cozy. Hardwood floors, which I prefer to carpet. Big bed, extremely comfortable (having arthritis I am pretty sensitive to those things). Extra pillows and blankets. A/C . A writing desk. A window I could actually open and enjoy the fresh air and the street sounds. Flat screen TV, mini bar. A very comfortable couch. The bathroom was very well designed. I liked the Italian shower and I like the cabinet to store my toilet items. The complimentary toiletteries (soap, body wash, shampoo, conditioner, body moisturizer) had a great quality. The mini bar was expensive, as with all the hotels, as it was the laundry service. There is Wi-fi but you need to pay for it, this is perhaps the only thing I did not like. For the laundry, near to the hotel there is a coin-operated Laundromat, pretty cheap (Rue Mayet). The breakfast buffet is nice, 14 Euros. Fresh squeezed orange juice, cold cuts, croissants, pastries, coffee… I found the quality of the food correct. The breakfast room feels a little bit cramped, though. The staff was simply wonderful, even in the middle of the chaos unleashed by the Icelandic volcano. Courteous, friendly, patient and efficient, it was a pleasure to deal with them. I am planning on going back to Paris next April and I will be back to the Aviatic, no doubt, I enjoyed my stay very much. It is a wonderful place and a better value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, reasonably priced, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: melissamazzei
Reviews.Content: Rooms on the small side, but typical for Paris. Close to the metro. Clean room. Near shopping.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back!”
Reviews.Author: Vtjournalist
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I've stayed at in Paris. Very good value for the price, Rooms are larger than average for Paris. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. Rooms are very modern. There is complimentary refreshments in the lobby each afternoon. The hotel is on a side street in Montparnarse. Just around the corner is a fantastic restaurant, Montparnarse 1900.

Reviews.Title: “Small but lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Radles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Paris over Easter Weekend and were lucky enough to stay at the Aviatic Hotel. We had a lovely room on the 6th Floor which had a Juliette balcony overlooking the street. The room felt like it had all been recently refurbished, with contemporary decor, wooden floors and a nice modern shower room. The room was a bit small but perfectly formed! The hotel staff (who all speak English) were really helpful, especially as I sprained my ankle on our last night there (Easter Sunday) and needed to see an emergency doctor. They arranged everything and had a doctor come to my room at 12.30 at night with no hassle to me whatsoever. Apart from this little drama - the staff had also been very helpful with advice on sight-seeing etc as well. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from a couple of Metro Stations and is on the Metro Line 4 which connects to all the major tourist attractions so its really convenient. We didnt have the hotel breakfast as we thought it was quite expensive (14€ per person) and the breakfast room is a bit small. I think you get a reasonable amount of choice, but for those who just want a coffee and croissant - there are some great cafe's in the area that provide simpler and more cost effective options (about 6€ per person instead)! Paris is an expensive city and this hotel is also pretty pricey. I guess what I would say though is that in Paris you can stay somewhere expensive and average or expensive and nice and The Aviatic is definitely in the latter category. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: sweetames
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Upon arrival, we were greeted and welcomed for staying at the hotel for the first time. We were assigned a beautiful and clean room. Every morning, we had breakfast in their breakfast room which offered many choices and options. There were fruits, cereal, eggs, toast, cheese and deli meat. Coffee and juice were also offered every morning. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would definitely recommend this hotel to others. We were very pleased with our stay there and made our trip to Paris a memorable one! We didn't stay in that much so we didn't notice the hotel not offering restaurants on site or Wifi. There were many cafes and restaurants in close vicinity for us to walk to and was never a problem. We preferred staying at this quaint hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's not in Saint Germain, but ok for price”
Reviews.Author: bellakaye
Reviews.Content: We accidentally booked this hotel and spent another 10 euros in our taxi trying to get here from Saint Germain. While the name has Saint Germain in it, it is misleading, it is in Montparnasse...it is still close by everything, a grocery store, great vietnamese restaurant, Lafayette store and crepe alley! Our room was teensy tiny, but what do you expect in Paris. I woke up one night in a panic attack, not knowing where I was and I had to open the window to let some fresh air in. The bathroom is definitely European sized. The staff at night was great. He was the only person that asked where we were from and didn't snub us for not speaking perfect French. I will prob stay in Saint Germain the next time in Paris because there are so many more shops and cafes right at your door...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel, excellent service, friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Katnorthyorks
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in March and absolutely adored this little gem, so much so in fact that we can't wait to return. This boutique hotel is both elegant and charming in the way it is both decorated and furnished and the staff have to be some of the friendliest we have ever encountered. The location of this hotel is fantastic with easy access to the tube station and a vast array of cafes, bars and restaurants at the end of the road. The breakfast room is particularly sweet and makes you feel more like you're having breakfast in a cafe. We were both more than pleased with the room we had been allocated and the level of comfort and cleanliness throughout the hotel. This hotel is a real little find.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, clean, great value”
Reviews.Author: girlfrommars82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon in February. The room was very quite small with basically enough room for the bed but extremely clean. The bathroom was really modern and quite large in comparison to the bedroom. We were out most of the time and loved how central the hotel was. It is close to Montparnasse railway station, lots of restaurants and we walked to the tourist attractions such as the Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Notre Dame etc. Breakfast was included and it was by the far the best breakfast we had in Europe and a real feature of the hotel. It included good quality bread, croissants, meats, fruit, yoghurt etc. The staff were friendly and polite. Would highly recommend this hotel for people that will be out most of the day and want somewhere comfortable, quiet and safe to stay at night that is centrally located and good value.

Reviews.Title: “perfect little gem - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: braddeluca
Reviews.Content: Okay, so i think we might have been upgraded to a recently reno'd room, but all in all this place is unreal. a charming little hotel within close walking distance of the amazing underground system that can whisk you across town befor you can can bonjour! the staff are incredible, and the free win and nibblies in the foyer in the evening are great! the internet is a little on the expensive side, but you dont travel to surf the net... it is very charming, and my only criticism of the room is that the shower rose is down quite low (I am only 5'11 and it was a little annoying. but it was hot, and plenty of pressure, so I am not complaining. the chinese restaurant on the main road nearby is awesome too!

Reviews.Title: “Super value for money”
Reviews.Author: merxell
Reviews.Content: We just cam from Paris with my wife after staying in the Aviatic Hotel Saint Germain for 4 nights. The hotel is very nice, the staff is very polite and helpful and the atmosphere of the hotel is cosy / boutique hotel type. We had the traditional room which is quite small but in Paris standards normal. Very clean, good shower, nice (a bit expensive) breakfast. The location is more Montparnasse but within walking distance of St.Germain and many metrostations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, boutique hotel in a goodlocation with fantastic transport links”
Reviews.Author: AdeleYemm
Reviews.Content: This small, intimate hotel is near to 4 metro stations making it very well connected to all the main sights in Paris. The Blvd Montparnasse is the next street over and offers a broad choice of restaurants and cafes, cinemas and a large shopping mall. The hotel was immaculately clean, well decorated, and had a lovely shower room stocked with extra special toiletries. Our room was a standard double, quiet (although facing the street), tastefully decorated and plenty warm enough given it was below zero (we went in February). The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke several languages. An excellent restaurant called Epi Dupin, located in rue Dupin, is just a short walk away and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “A charming, stylish hotel - check their website for bargainous offers!”
Reviews.Author: DeanPorterLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location if you don't want to be in the thick of Touristville, but do want to be near everything at a walkable distance Very friendly staff Newly refurbished room And some superb offers on the website. We booked a few months in advance and ended up paying 90 euro for the room. 45 euro each when sharing. Great value for Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in Paris, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Dani_Australia10
Reviews.Content: I had heard about the hotel from a colleague with whom I used to work, she had recommended to stay at this hotel as she had a great time during her stay in Paris. The hotel is located on Rue Vaugirard a quiet street just off the Boulevard of Montparnasse, the location is central and easy and is only a short walk to shops, bars and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helpful, they made us feel very comfortable during our stay. It's one of the things we most liked about the hotel. All the staff speak perfect English so if your worried about not being able to converse in French, don't as a lot of people speak English in Paris. The room was small , but was enough for my sister and I, but for the price we absolutely loved it. Most hotel rooms in Paris are small, so you have to expect that. The decor has a pretty French vibe and the rooms were very clean. The bathroom was suitable with all the amenities necessary. We absolutely loved our stay at Aviatic, we hope to stay there again in the near future. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking at travelling to the beautiful city of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable resting place in the heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: ElspethCambridge
Reviews.Content: We liked the room immediately as the decor was quiet and tasteful. The small problem of the bed arrangement not being what we asked for (!) was resolved quickly and without question. Breakfasts were good whether we took the full 14 Euro option or the Petit dejeuner Express in our room for 7Euro. In short, a great little hotel within reach of major attractions with friendly and informative staff.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: BootsOnNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in January 2010 at the Aviatic. We found it on Trip Advisor, when we couldn't book into the hotel we'd first intended to use. Thus, we were a little anxious about what it would be like. Well, it couldn't have been nicer. Yes, the rooms are a little tight (but perfectly comfortable), and, yes, it is not in the heart of St. Germaine, but our room was charmingly decorated and impeccably clean, the staff was incredibly helpful and pleasant, and we really came to like the neighborhood as we got to know it. Also, it was easy to walk to so many places, and the Metro was only about a block and a half away for longer trips. In short, it turned out to be a real find. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: anto92
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms a beautiful atmosphere. Extremly friendly staff across the board... making you feel at homz all the time, always accomadating area very convenient close to everyting 10/10 for Aviatic !

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JulienHunt
Reviews.Content: we booked in this hotel for 2 nights on a week-end trip with my girlfriend and we were not disappointed. In a quiet street but only meters away from the public transport and stacks of restaurants, we arrived to be met by some of the friendliest service I have ever encountered. The room was impeccable and quiet. The service charming...........a place I will go back to again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TorontoFunSeekers
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in Aug 2009. Found hotel thru TripAdvisor. No complaints. Very nice, clean hotel. We found the price to be very fair. Room was typically small Paris room but very modern and clean. Free wine in the lobby at night. Overall positive experience. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It is lovely, cosy.”
Reviews.Author: norci77
Reviews.Content: It is a very well-decorated hotel with a friendly staff, mainly Nicolas who is a "language- and restaurant-expert":).
