The room was very clean and cosy just like the other parts of the hotel. The breakfast "looks" overprised but it is four-stars level. The home-made pudding is delicious!!! The location was perfect, the Montparnasse-tower always "show " the way home. I really recommend this hotel and we will come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: flowersm
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days at the Aviatic around Christmas 2009. The 2 best things (and there are many more) about this hotel is the staff and the location. The genuine interest in you by the staff was very welcoming. Bruce and Marilyn were very helpful with many questions and were patient with our awkward French (they spoke English quite well). We booked this 6 months in advance (great early bird special) and were really clueless to how ideal the location was. The Montparnasse Metro stop was just around the corner and that became the hub for our daily adventures in the city. Once we figured out the Metro, we saw that we couldn't have picked a better location. This is a small hotel that is a great place to come back to each day-very calming after a busy day of museums and crowds of people. Finally, we found their Express Breakfast for 7 Euros (delivered to your room) to be one of the better values for the trip. We found Paris basically expensive all around-but the Hotel didn't stiff you like many do. This was our first trip to Paris and the Aviatic was a big part of it's success.

Reviews.Title: “Second Trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Travel_guy58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aviatic Hotel , in the Saint Germain area of Paris on our last visit to Paris in Oct 2009. The hotel was also an easy walk from several Metro stops, with lots of Bistro and restaurant choices in the neighbourhood.The hotel was also within "a good walking distance" of Napoleon's Tomb and the Eiffel Tower as well. The hotel is very well presented and the staff were pleasent and helpful. The room was cozy but quite nice, with a beautiful fully equipped bathroom. There was also a well outfitted and cozy breakfast room just off the lobby. I would definitely reccommend the hotel for anyone looking for a upper mid-range price bracket.

Reviews.Title: “Two experience: one great, the other terrible”
Reviews.Author: Cramond07
Reviews.Content: I've at the Aviatic two times now. The first time, was in June 2007 and was fantastic. We had a fabulous room in the front part of the hotel. Great bed, very elegant and huge bathroom - for Paris standars -. It was inmaculate. That's why when we decided to return we didn't think it twice. But the experience was terrible. It looked like we were staying in a hostel. The room was very small, it was like we were in a closet turn into room. The bathroom was so small. I still don´t know why there are two kinds of rooms in this hotel. On the other hand, the location is good. Not excellent. But it is three or four blocks from a metro station but most of the time we walked all around

Reviews.Title: “paris getaway”
Reviews.Author: jajLasVegas
Reviews.Content: my wife and I just left . clean and friendly front desk, quiet nights, stylish room close to nice restuarants would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: 8505johnc
Reviews.Content: The room was not as advertised and the management could not have cared less. Quote "We already have your money it is OK if you go somewhere else" So, if you like paying for business class and then flying coach, this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Poor room. Bad staff attitude.”
Reviews.Author: blomap_friend
Reviews.Content: I've booked the hotel based on the other reviews. The experience was disappointed. Rude/indifferent staff. Small and uncomfortable room. Hotel needs to be refurbished. I don't understand the enthusiastic reviews. I paid EUR 144 per night. The price for such a kind of hotel should be under EUR 80

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Easyfour
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aviatic Hotel for three nights in November 2009. The hotel staff was very accomodating in helping arrange transportation from the airport to the hotel and for allowing me to check in a little early. The room was not huge, but was big enough by Paris standards and I found it very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was fairly large and was clean as well. The bath robes were really great! I enjoyed the breakfast buffet a couple of times during my stay and found that it fit my needs both in substance and price. The staff were always polite and helpful, even when answering my fiftieth question. I really loved the place and will definitely go back the next time I'm in Paris. The only thing I wish they'd change is their Internet fee. It's pretty expensive and not what you'd expect from a smaller hotel. I don't expect everything for free, but it does seem steep. Also, there is a constuction project going on across the street. While it didn't bother me, some travelers who sleep late may want to consider it when choosing a room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: tcusatis
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at aviatic in sep/09 for 6 nights and really loved the hotel. The staff is really helpful, expecially Bruce. We didn't had their breakfast, but it is maybe a good idea if you need a complete meal. We usually had a croassaint + coffee for 3 euros next to saint-placide station, and it was ok for us... The room is really small, but it was not a problem for us, because we were out all day. The furniture was better then the photos published on trip advisor, I think the hotel was renovated. They have a safe and a frigobar in the room. There is 3 things I would consider before going back to the aviatic: - Internet is not free, it is actually really expensive!!! - They charged us 15 euros for a plug adaptor, and all other hotels we stayed in europe lent us one for no charge. - They are not in the best part of saint germain. It is actually really close to montparnasse, there is 2 subway nearby that will get you to the main touristic atractions without changing lines, but I would prefer to be next to bolevard st germain next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tasukete
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Aviatic for 9 days during the month of September. I chose this hotel based on the value and the great reviews and wasn't at all disappointed. The airport transfer was very convenient and I believe cost us 17 euro for 2 people. We arrived very early in the morning and even though check in wasn't until 3 pm they got a room ready for us about an hour later which was great. The rooms really are small but very well decorated and planned out. Considering the 9 day stay we unpacked which made getting around easier since we weren't living out of our suitcases. The staff were great! The only little hiccup was the guy at the front desk when we were checking out. My bank was blocking transactions because they were coming through as fraudulent and he didn't seem too amused by it. When another employee arrived we got the problem taken care off though. They had wine available every night int he lobby and tour bus tickets can be purchased at the front desk. The hotel looks like it has very recently been remodeled so everything is fresh and new and pleasant. The location was pretty convenient and we got around using the metro very easily. Lot's of restaurants and cafes all around. Our favorite was the sushi place right on the street, I don't remember the name but it was wonderful so I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lusant
Reviews.Content: We have stayied at Aviatic Hotel two years ago and it was splendid. This year we had only two days to stay at Paris and, undoubtedly, we chose, again, the Aviatic.We would like to thank the pleasant staff, specially Marilyn, always atentious with us. The hotel offers an excellent breakfast, is located near Montparnasse metro station, good restaurants nearby. Although small, the room is nicely decorated, like the entire hotel. We would like to suggest to improve the black out of the room. We highly recommend the Aviatic!

Reviews.Title: “Dull yet expensive rooms, with shockingly rude staff”
Reviews.Author: SJ13London
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a so-so area. We chose it as my partner had to go to a conference nearby, but if I was in Paris for pleasure, I'd choose a different area. It's a 20 or so min walk to the heart of St Germain, although there are a couple of tube stops 7 to 10 mins walk away. The common areas of the hotel are pretty, so it's a shame that the same attention hadn't been paid to my room. The photos on the hotel website are very deceptive and nothing like the reality - I'd paid extra for a "superior" room, yet it looked like a slightly chinztier version of a travelodge. Very sparse and a bit shabby. The room also stank of smoke, despite the hotel claiming it was a no smoking room. We asked for another room, but the one we were shown was dark and dingy with two single beds rather than a double, so we stuck with the smoky room. At least it was quite light, none more so than at night, when the sign outside the hotel illuminated the room. It was also quite noisy - not too bad with the windows closed, but you couldn't open them and bear the noise for long. The hotel charge for wifi access - 8 euro for 1 hour, 24 euro for 1 day. I thought this unneccessarily high, and mean when one is paying 190 euro a night for a room. Perhaps worst of all though, was the attitude of the staff. We asked for an iron to be sent up to the room, and were told this was not possible. We asked if there was a laundry room where we could use an iron, as we had a suitcase of clothes that needed pressing (my partner was there for a business meeting). They said no, but they had a laundry service that could press them (8 euros per shirt...) Eventually they agreed to press 3 items for free. 1 came back unironed, 1 badly ironed, 1 ok. Upon checking out, they tried to charge us for this pressing. When we explained that a member of staff had offered to press 3 items free of charge, the receptionist argued, denied it, and was incredibly rude and aggressive. He claimed that there is a french law that states irons are not permitted in hotel rooms - curious then, that I've come across several people who've recently had irons in their Paris hotel rooms. Perhaps a ploy to get us to use their expensive yet not very good laundry service? Eventually, he called the manager who agreed to "waive" the charge. It was a thoroughly upsetting and stressful end to our stay. All in all, a most unsatisfactory hotel, and I can't really understand why it's rated so highly on tripadvisor. There are many better hotels in better locations of Paris for less money. I'd avoid this one for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for price and location, pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: luckyduc
Reviews.Content: I have recently seen updated photos since our trip a year ago. It looks like the hotel has undergone some much needed updated. That is great news for a nice little hotel that had so much potential! When we visited, the hotel was quiet and tidy. The staff were very pleasant, especially since my husband speaks fluent French. There is no elevator and rooms along the small, winding staircase in the back suffer from noise of guests banging their luggage up and down the stairs. Fortunately, you don't spend much time in your room during the day. However, light sleepers take note: the Metro starts running at 5am and sounds as if it runs directly under the hotel. However, you will be exhausted from sightseeing by day two and will learn to sleep through the hum of the train. Our room was clean and pleasant, though a bit shabby and needed updating. It looks as though that has been done recently. The bathroom was small and efficient and very clean, with nice soaps and shampoos which I promptly stuffed in my bag in hopes of getting more the next day (what luck, they were replenished!). I was reluctant to book this hotel from the mixed reviews, but glad I did in the end. It is a nice hotel in a good neighborhood away from all the tourists. It is plenty close to several major Metro stops and in close vicinity to a lovely corner-diner type cafe with strong coffee and wonderful crepes. Next door is a noodle shop with the most intoxicating aromas. Also, try dining at Le Bec Rouge a few blocks away. You won't be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “fantistic hotel in a great location, close to metro; wish they had free wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: mkriegal
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with Aviatic. Just a few months ago I stayed at a hotel no more than a few blocks away that was 4 stars, and this 3 star hotel blew it out of the water. The room was large for being in Paris, the whole decoration scheme of the hotel and the room were something out of a 5 star hotel, and the bed was quite comfortable. The location may not be near all the main tourist attractions, but it's right near some very useful metro stops, or you could just walk like us. I liked being away from some of the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas. Everyone at the front desk was very nice / helpful. I would definitely recommend the hotel, especially with the great price we paid. I'm also pretty sure our room was upgraded from what we had originally booked for no charge. One complaint, no free wi-fi / internet, charging for wi-fi just seems greedy from any hotel. I would recommend that they include free wi-fi to those staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps good for the price but there are better areas in Paris to stay.”
Reviews.Author: WhiteMountainHiker
Reviews.Content: The Aviatic St. Germain is a reasonably priced hotel for Paris ($250/night) and I think it is representative of what one can get for this price, since the city is full of expensive hotels. The rooms and bathrooms have been re-done but the bedroom is so small the room is really just the bed with a narrow walkway out on each side. The bathroom is well appointed with a cute sliding door and oversize shower. The room is energy efficient and requires that you put in your hotel key card to activate the lights! The room was calm and the bed and linens were fine but this is not a place for anyone claustrophobic. Also, I think the floor below us allowed smoking in the rooms so the smell of smoke drifted up to our room. Our window faced into a small inner area so it was quiet but not much light. The location is close to the Musee d'Armee and the Eiffel Tower. There really isn't much in this part of town, so unlike other areas where you can leave your hotel and quickly find a bakery or cafe (many of them) there is only one cafe nearby and a bakery a couple of blocks down. You can walk to the heart of St. Germain (in about 15 minutes). The breakfast buffet, while convenient, was overpriced at 14 EURO and in particular, had an automatic coffee machine that made an instant version of coffee drinks that tasted awful, particularly in light of all the good coffee readily available in cafes! The breakfast room was also tiny and crowded. The desk staff, however, was very helpful and pleasant. There is an Internet kiosk in the lobby for guest use. While Paris is infinitely accessible on foot and through the metro, I would recommend staying in the Marais (outstanding area on the right bank), St. Germain or Ile d'Louis.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: luvmolly
Reviews.Content: The desk staff at the hotel spoke excellent English and were very courteous, friendly, and helpful. Our room was spotless on arrival, and the daily cleaning kept it that way. I loved the hardwood floors--no "secrets" hiding in the carpet! Each evening complimentary wines and snacks were set out in the lobby, and the morning breakfast was good. I hope to return some day!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Class in great location”
Reviews.Author: louisehenders10
Reviews.Content: We ended our honeymoon here and arrived after a long train journey at 12.30am. The receptionist was friendly and helpful and made us feel totally relaxed. The room was small but adequately sized and very nicely decorated. The rest of the hotel was beautifully decorated and had a warm welcoming feel. The breakfast is on the expensive side at 14 euros per person. We had breakfast there for two days and enjoyed the selection and quality of the food. However, I would suggest a trip to one of the many boulangerie's in the area. We went to a place near St Placide metro which is ten minutes walk from the hotel and enjoyed the amazing breads/pastries for only 10 euros for both of us. The location of the hotel is also fantastic. Five minutes walk from Montparnasse Bienvenue and lots of lovely restaurants such as L'Horloge Brasserie and Le Rousseau both on the Rue du Cherche-Midi. Overall we had an amazing time and staying in the Aviatic made our honeymoon. We would both strongly recommend it and look forward to staying there again soon

Reviews.Title: “The perfect home base for a week in Paris”
Reviews.Author: amccutcheon
Reviews.Content: My mother and I traved to Paris for 4 days in early September. We booked thru a travel agency who helped us to find the Aviatic Hotel. What a great hotel it was! It was located close to the Montparnasse-Bienvenue Metro station, which made it a great home base for the trip. The room was a bit small, but not so much to make it uncomfortable. The entire hotel is very clean and the staff is extreamly friendly and helpful. The breakfast in the morning is a perfect way to jumpstart our days. I would highligh recommend the hotel to anyone staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: kry_starz
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at this hotel!!! My husband and I were on a 19 day trip throughout Europe, and this was one of the best hotels we stayed at. It was quite small, but had an amazingly comfy bed and a very cool bathroom with a big shower. We were also on the top floor and had a cool little balcony to look out over. It was also nicely located very close to a major Metro stop, which is how we traveled around the city. We thought the breakfast was over priced so we passed on that since there are tons of cafe's in the area. Also, the staff is beyond nice and Extremely helpful! Good english too. While there you must go to the sushi place around the corner - 'Sushi Cafe Restaurant Japonais' located at 20, Reu de l'Arrivee. I know it sounds crazy, but it was hands down the best food, best wine, best atmosphere, and best service we experienced in the city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location 4 star hotel bueatifully appointed rooms with attentive professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: Wayne50
Reviews.Content: The Aviatic Hotel location is in one of the best locations on the left bank in Paris. The hotel does not have it's own restaurant but it does provide an extensive continential buffet breakfast in a saloon where they also offer complimentary cocktails in the evening. The hotel is surrounded by an abundence of fine restaurants within 2 - 5 minutes walk, also close to metro and tourist bus pick up point. We found the staff very helpful, friendly and attentive to our needs, our room was beautifully appointed and would rate as a 4 star hotel rather than a 3 star. Our next visit to Paris we will definetely be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “true parisian style! fantastic value for money with homely comforts”
Reviews.Author: roseladyLondon
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my friend for short trip. The staff are amazing..friendly courteous and kind. My friend became ill and within an hour they had a doctor to the room! Its is gorgeous to look at and made our trip just that little more special! Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond three stars”
Reviews.Author: Minda84
Reviews.Content: I was so overwhelmed when trying to decide where to stay in Paris, but this place was perfect. It's located close to metro stops, lots of cafes and shops, and the Gare Montparnasse Train Station (where we caught the train to Bordeaux). The whole builiding is decorated in a beautiful French style, without being kitschy. We booked a standard double room, and it was a good size with a lovely bathroom. The staff were very helpful no matter what the request. A lovely breakfast is available for 14 Euros. WiFi time can also be purchased, and there's a nice sitting room downstairs for guests to use. I would highly recomend this lovely hotel, and it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “This is where you want to stay in Paris, hands down.”
Reviews.Author: brad57vett
Reviews.Content: There are myriad hotels in Paris, and choosing one can be a daunting crapshoot. Unlike years ago, a variety of websites now enable the visitor to scan comments of recent visitors. The analog equivalent (such as the collegiate Let’s Go series) can not readily account for changes in management and conditions discovered only upon arrival. But even the current website trawling leaves one queasy with uncertainty, as the same venue is both loved and hated by recent residents. Eventually, one relies on the advice of a trusted recent visitor or one takes a hopeful stab at the internet descriptions. If you want to choose the former, go with Aviatic Hotel St Germain. The hotel is in Montparnesse, near enough to a Metro stop. It is impeccably clean, quiet and reasonably priced. The helpful staff steered us into our crisp rooms, tastefully appointed despite their size. In that every hotel room in Paris is quaint in size, and given that one desires to spend a majority of time outside the hotel room, we had no trouble with our accommodations at the Aviatic. The subtle lighting, the steady air conditioning, the generous shower and bath facilities and the solidly comfortable beds made for a haven from the unseasonably warm Parisian weather. Each morning we started our day with the included petite dejeuner, a breakfast with the traditional baguettes, cheeses, light meats, yogurt, cereals, coffees, fruits and the obligatory divine chocolate croissants. The Aviatic Hotel St Germainis an ideal Parisian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 1118jacqui
Reviews.Content: A beautiful little hotel with light airy rooms and pleanty of space, a novelty for Paris (we stayed in a superior double) . The staff were attentive and very friendly and the room was spotless. The room was also blissfully quiet (being on a side street makes a HUGE difference) and I LOVED the pilows - soft and fluffy and 2 of them each!!! The hotel was 2 mins for the metro making travel incredibly simple and easy all across Paris. This is a hotel I would definately recommend to anyone, I loved it. Book early and the prices are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Hotel in a great district of Paris”
Reviews.Author: LilyLipstick
Reviews.Content: My daugther and I stayed here for three nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We already noticed that when we made the reservations. Our room was clean, quiet and very cosy. We had aiconditioning, a minibar and television. Although we would have liked more choice in channels. Breakfast was lovely. We even could have it in our room. The location is very good. Restaurants, shops, supermarkets and the subway are nearby. We enjoyed our stay and we will certainly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Christine5500
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great location.Rooms very comfortable.Staff friendly and helpful.A lovely breakfast room.If we travel to Paris again we would certainly stay at the Aviatic. To top it all the weather was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lucixo
Reviews.Content: We had a really pleasant stay in this hotel. Location is perfect, staff helpful and kind, rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: StAlbansBean
Reviews.Content: Really great location within easy access of the Metro. Very clean rooms and well decorated. Very helpful staff. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel, friendly staff, upscale for great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ethan65
Reviews.Content: Wow! Spent a wonderful anniversary weekend in Paris and this hotel was perfect for the visit. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the location was central to all areas in Paris most visit. Close to metro stops, close to great sidewalk cafe's. Hotel doesn't have many amenities (why would you need them when Paris abounds), hotel is over the top on style, very picturesque, very comfortable, great price. I would stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: DopCornwall
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights in a clean, well decorated room on the 1st floor. The staff, throughout our visit, were friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. While the breakfast room was on the small side we could not fault the service. The hotel is in an excellent position near both Metro and many and varied restaurants. As my wife and I are vegans we were pleased to find so many places where we could eat. An excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable boutique hotel with amazingly helpful & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dandjaway
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Aviatic for 2 nights on 6 & 7 August 2009. I booked a joint reservation for ourselves in one room & a second room for my sister & her son. Our rooms were just perfect - exactly like the photos on the website, brand new decor, stylish & modern. We were in rooms 236 & 237 - across the hall from one another, so very convenient for us to coordinate. Our bathrooms were great - amazing water pressure, impeccably clean. The A/C was amazing & kept us cool - as when we arrived in Paris it was 30 Degrees Celsius - 86 Degrees Fahrenheit. Our bed was perfectly comfortable & I always love having more than one pillow to sleep with at night - there were 2 spare in the closet/wardrobe. Our room was very quiet so we slept very well. The hotel staff were as helpful as their counterparts in a 5 star hotel. The area of where the hotel was located made it very easy to access multiple Metro stations. Upon our arrival on the Eurostar, we simply took the Metro (we always buy the carnet of Metro tickets as they are cheaper than buying single tickets & more economical is a daily travelcard doesn't suit either) & then walked a few blocks to the hotel - easy peasy. On our checkout day, we were leaving at about 6 PM. The hotel staff kindly stored our bags in the secure baggage area until we had to head off. We didn't eat at the hotel at all, just so we could stroll around more. But the prices for their breakfast were not far off what we paid at various cafes for similar fare. So, don't feel like you'd be cheated if you ate the petit dejeuner inhouse at the hotel. This stay it was such great value for money for us. August isn't peak season in Paris as most Parisians are on holiday/vacation themselves or they leave Paris at the weekend to escape the heat. I'd happily stay there again & have recommended it to others, too!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: J-Rossy
Reviews.Content: The staff were very polite and helpful. we found the hotel easily from the Metro and it was well positioned for routes around Paris. The rooms were Quaint and comfy, Food was good and just generally really enjopyed our stay! Will recommend to friends and family! CHEERS AVIATIC!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a central location”
Reviews.Author: bar_jo_toronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Hotel Aviatic. The hotel is well situated in the Montparnasse area which we found ideal for access to many areas of the city. The staff are very friendly and helpful and our room was very clean, updated, and comfortable. We would definately use the hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quaint hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Simba1213
Reviews.Content: The Aviatic is a great all around hotel in a wonderful neighborhood of Paris. The staff is very helpful and gave great recommendations for dinner. Rooms are small, but clean and modern. Bathrooms are a good size and showers are nice. Walk to the metro is less than 5 minutes. There is also a little supermarket nearby to buy water and other essentials cheaply. We did not purchase the breakfast at 14 Euros per person, but it looked nice. We would definitely stay at the Aviatic again. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “A truly lovely place to stay, with a warm welcome and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: evelyn_and_thom
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and so much enjoyed it. The hotel is tastefully decorated, as was our room, which was very comfortable, very clean, quiet, and not small at all. Nice and quite big bathroom too. Above all, the staff was terrific. Everyone was so friendly and helpful, with a good portion of humour too. :) Prices were very reasonable. If we should come back to Paris one day, we will definitely stay at this charming hotel again. Thank you!!! Evelyn and Thom (Mainz/DE and New York City/USA)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyaspappy
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 3 nights at this lovely hotel. Great location and very helpful and friendly staff. The room was clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: PittTraveler
Reviews.Content: In a quiet neighborhood but an easy walk to the Metro. The rooms are modern and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and the rooms are reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with French Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Lareks
Reviews.Content: Before staying in the Hotel, I like to know more about its history, attractions, that are situated near by, location. What I noted first in the Aviatic was its location, that it is situated on the longest street at the corner of Montparnasse, where great artists lived, worked, had fun. Here you can always find a place to have fun at night, even in the other parts of Paris life dies down. Then I read about the interesting history of the Hotel. It was here where Madame de Montespan raised the children of Louis XIV and after that became his morganatic wife. The Hotel exceeded my expectations. I am staying herefor the 6th time already and feel like coming home. Wonderful staff, friendly atmosphere, very tasty breakfast and refined interors. I would advise everybody to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Aviatic”
Reviews.Author: MicheleW09
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel with friendly staff and tasteful decor. Good location in a quiet spot within easy access to the metro and walking distance to all the sites. Lovely room, not ample in size but the spacious shower made up for this! Apperitif at 6.00pm for all guests and a handy pack of mints on check out were great added extras. One tip - make sure you are equipped with a good map of Paris to avoid arguments with your other half!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, Very Reasonably Priced, Clean, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanne7777
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a god send; I found it online at the last minute, and was impressed but doubtful of all the excellent reviews. Hats off though, because it's all true! This hotel is simply everything you want a hotel to be, it is well located (in the Saint Germain district right next to one of the main metro cross over points), perfectly functional (we had a lovely little shower room en suite, air con, TV & minibar!) and remarkably well cleaned (and we never got disturbed by the cleaner either!) The hotel staff always sent us out in a good mood, recommending restaurants and travel routes and even lending us a mains adapter so that we could charge our English camera! Oh, and the room looked just like it did in the photo! I love being able to see what you're getting before you book! I am even more amazed now having stayed in Paris about how well valued this hotel is, it was the most economical thing we did! Definitely planning to revisit in the long term...

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel to recommend and revisit.”
Reviews.Author: minibix17
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through trip advisor and was a little skeptical about all the good reviews written about it. But after staying there for two nights I now know they are all genuine and justified. The staff consistently did everything they could to help us make the most of our stay. They were friendly, animated and knowledgable. Email correspondance prior to our arrival was prompt and informing. The hotel décor was subtly stylish and was maintained and cleaned beautifully. The location was central and helped to maximise our short time in the city. On our departure recpetion booked us a taxi to the airport and offered us some water or juice while we waited (albeit a 2 minute wait for the taxi). He also gave us some hotel mints as a souvenir which was a nice touch and maintained the welcoming feel of our stay. My only complaint would be about the airport shuttle service the hotel prebooked for us for our arrival to the hotel. The shuttle was over half hour late, despite asking us to call when we had landed so they could be ready for us outside. We called more than once to let them know we had been waiting a long time and when it arrived the driver was rude and dismissive. He also stopped off at a fuel station on our way so he could use the bathroom and buy some snacks. I felt this was unacceptable. However, the shuttle company, Yellow Van shuttle.com, were a third party booked by the hotel and the receptionist did ask us how the shuttle was, giving us a chance to complain. Overall, Hotel Aviatic helped to make an unforgettable weekend break in Paris and I would definitely revisit or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelnut113
Reviews.Content: In a great location, the Aviatic is a charming and comfortable base. The standard rooms are a bit on the small side but are impeccably designed in a modern theme - and the bathrooms are as good as any in a hotel of this category. Facilities are limited but there is a pleasant lounge and breakfast area. Reception staff were very friendly and more than willing to help and advise. The hotel is probably not cheap for what you get but it, in its own right, it's something of a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: DALI_9
Reviews.Content: I researched the reviews made by other travelers on Trip Advisor. With the exception of the hotel staff members, my experience at the Aviatic St. Germaine was not as positive as the rest of the people who have commented about this hotel. The hotel does not look, at all, as it does in the pictures. It is mostly a whole in the wall. The furniture is outdated and musty, both in the reception area and the room. As others have mentioned, the rooms are relatively spacious for Paris standards, and fairly comfortable. However, the carpet, comforter, curtains, etc. are old and stained. Do not buy the breakfast package. The price per person is 14 EUR. The breakfast room is no larger than 10X10 foot, cramped space, with 4 tables (and little space to slide into seats). No hot meals; mostly a table with bread, yougurt, and fruit. You can get, instead, breakfast at the restaurant across the street. Two eggs, ham, coffee, and orange juice for 10 Euros. If you decide to book here, I hope you have a better experience. Next time, I would rather pay slightly more for a better place than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “what a fab place”
Reviews.Author: htwong37
Reviews.Content: Aviatic locates near to many popular restaurants and it is convenient. It provides welcome drinks for customers. The room is clean and very tidy. The bathroom is newly renovated. The toiletories are unexpectedly great. The reception is very nice and very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Brilliant staff in a Brillaint Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: littletee78
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aviatic was just BRILLIANT! Paulo, Bruce & Zhenyi were just sensational and they made our stay in Paris very comfortable. This Hotel is in a brilliant location in the centre of Paris, I cannot recommend it highly enough and we can't wait to go back. Thank you to the Hotel Aviatic team for everything, hope to see you all soon again and keep up the brilliant work! HIGHLY recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxed, friendly, clean hotel that was good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MVJS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully designed with good sized clean rooms. The staff were very friendly which made the atmosphere relaxed. We found the location convenient for all the sightseeing trips that we wanted to do. I would definitely recommend this hotel and plan to stay here the next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “As good as expected”
Reviews.Author: Punamytsike
Reviews.Content: Ending up at Hotel Aviatic was a result of hours of research and I'm glad to say we made the right decision. Before booking, we had a little hussle over the price of accommodation (being in hotel business myself I know how much bargaining room there usually is, so I never accept the rack rate), but we finally agreed on the price that seemed reasonable for us and got complimentary breakfast as well. As it was our first time in Paris, we booked a shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel at arrival to make sure we ended up at the right place. However, next time we'll surely use the metro and advise others to do the same - the price difference is huge! We spent 3 nights at Aviatic and nothing bad can be said - the reception staff was polite and helpful and mostly spoke good English (with one exception), the rooms were of decent size, nicely decorated and clean. We especially liked all the little details - fresh flowers at the lobby, antique calendar on the front desk, unconventional temperature-regulating system in the shower, etc. The walls were a little thin, but as our room was facing the courtyard, no noise came in to disturb our good night sleep. Compared to what we encountered in the rest of France, breakfast at Aviatic was plentiful enough - good coffee, a decent selection of cheese, pastry, jam, and cereals. No hot dishes included in the price, unfortunately, but this was compensated by freshly squeesed orange juice, which gave a nice boost to start the day. The location is good if you don't mind walking a little (or if you do, there is always the subway), Les Invalides, the Eiffel tower and the Luxembourg gardens can surely be reached on foot. We also tried the Velib-bikes, which can be taken and returned all over the city. Cycle tracks are also almost everywhere, so you don't have to drive in the middle of the rest of the traffic. Only make sure that you leave the bike to the rental station whenever you are planning to walk around and not use it, otherwise it might become more expensive than expected. All in all - we will certainly return to Paris in the future and probably choose hotel Aviatic as a place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: islandcindy
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 4-day trip to Paris. It was my second visit, and my husband's first. Both times (previously 9/2005) I stayed at the Aviatic Hotel and both times enjoyed it very much. On my first visit I spent quite a bit of time researching hotel options before making a final decision. This time I didn't have to! My French language skills are practically non-existent, and everyone that I spoke with at the front desk spoke very good English, and they were also very friendly. The room is fairly large by European standards, and it is kept very clean by the housekeeping staff. The location is perfect - a short walk to the Metro/subway station, from which you can easily travel anywhere in the city. A train station is also there, but we didn't use the train. The hotel is about 1/2 block off Montparnasse Blvd, so it is quiet. There there are a lot of restaurants within a short walk from the hotel along Montparnasse Blvd. Because of our short stay, and timing of activities, we did not purchase the breakfast offered by the hotel this visit, but I enjoyed it very much when I stayed in 2005. I plan to stay there again on my next visit to Paris - and would highly recommend Aviatic Hotel. Note of caution: There is another hotel in Paris with a very similar name. Make sure that you are staying at the Aviatic Hotel on Rue de Vaugirard.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Elegance with excellent reception staff and quality decor.”
Reviews.Author: Oxscot
Reviews.Content: I booked this for 2 nights starting June 11 (my wife's 60th birthday). Easy to reach from Gard du Nord, great reception staff with good English, loved the decor, good sized room for Paris, plenty haqnging and shelf space and good bathroom with shwer above bath. Nice airflow by opening windows but at ight the aircon worked a treat and was silent. The breakfast room was small but good quality breads and juices to set us up for the day. The orange juice seemed fresh squeezed, most delicious. Many places to eat within a short walk with a number of choices (French, Italian, Indian, Lebanese, Fish) and easy to get around the city from the local Metro 10 minutes walk away. We would certainly recommend the Aviatic and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: RisoStudio
Reviews.Content: Though a little compact, off the beaten path. Returning to the hotel at the end of the day is like returning home. Staff is gracious and goes above and beyond to help it's guests in anyway. Management, especially Nicholas makes a genuine effort to connect with every guest and get to know each one personally. Contrary to what you might hear about Parisians, their is no snob appeal here. There is a true exchange of cultures. All support staff from housekeeping, to morning breakfast to the front-desk is what sells this property. It's a family endeavor and the guests become part of it. We are both travel agents and have been traveling throughout Europe previewing properties for our clients. We were thoroughly impressed and will be recommending this property to any and all clients/friends that will be traveling to Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinotravel
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice 4 night stay at the Aviatic. Located in St. Germain/Montparnasse we found the location worked well for sightseeing with two metro statios nearby. Situated in an appealing, old building on a quiet street, the hotel was recently remodeled and clean and tidy. The decor is elegant and tasteful, the rooms are on the small side but adequate for our needs. The staff was friendly and helpful. This was 1 of 4 hotels I stayed at on a 2 week trip through Spain and France and was my all around favorite. I would stay here again and would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Would Use Again”
Reviews.Author: happypantsy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 9 nights. Because it was our honeymoon, the hotel upgraded our room for free to a "deluxe." The staff was very, very good. I can't say enough good things about them. Always helpful, incredibly friendly and accommodating, and spoke English very well (which we were grateful for since our French is horrible). We had an excellent room on the top (6th) floor, and because the weather was so perfect (sunny in the upper 60s and lower 70s) we were able to have the windows open through the night for some nice breezes. The room was a little dusty -- it could have been vacuumed/cleaned a little better, but it was very minor and didn't really bother us at all. It's also possible we wouldn't have had as nice of a time there if we'd had a lesser room or if it'd been really hot and we couldn't have the windows open. But as it was, it was just perfect and we'd definitely stay there again. The street (rue de vaugirard) the hotel is on is just okay... not terribly cute really like some of the streets in Paris. But the hotel is overall in a very good location, in very reasonable walking distance to good brasseries, restaurants, the metro, theaters, Internet cafe, etc. Safe and clean and convenient. If you love coffee, I wouldn't bother with the hotel breakfast. It's 14 euros a person and while the food is fine (various breads, fruit, etc), they have an automatic coffee machine that squirts out pretty weak, bland cafe cremes or au laits. But this is really minor.. you should go out and hit one of the nearby cafes for a petite or grande dejeuner anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: grepat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aviatic hotel for four nights (1/6/2009 - 5/6/2009) and had a pleasant stay. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a deluxe room although we hadn't booked one -room was not big, but that is the rule for hotels in Paris. The room was spotlessly clean -which is not always the rule for hotels in Paris- and the staff helpful. Location very convenient, as it is close to a central train/metro station, thus close to Paris sights as well. We would recommend the hotel and would stay there again ourselves. P.S. Those travelling with luggage, should be prepared for the fact that Metro stations in Paris, in pricipal, are not equipped with elevators or escalators...

Reviews.Title: “Charming well decorated hotel, with very nice and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JacquiO45
Reviews.Content: I communicated with the hotel a few months prior to our stay and was able tp negotiate a reasonable price. All the staff members were very friendly and helpful I likes Bruce a lot since he was the one we got most of our directions and suggestions from. The decor was elegant and the room was so so clean. The only think we didn't like is the shower set up. The water would leak out the glass and l;left water on the floor of a very small bathroom. All rooms are small in Paris though. We needed one of our children to stay 2 night unexpectedly and they helped ous out and provided everything we needed late at night. We will go back to it.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: Blesers
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Paris, and the accommodations were excellent. I had heard how small the hotel rooms are in Europe, but our room was actually larger than I had expected. Still small by US standards, but very nice, and absolutely spotlessly clean (even under the bed and behind the mini-fridge). Probably the cleanest hotel room I've ever seen, and I travel extensively for work. Great shower. Our window opened to the street, and it was fun to watch all the activity. Yet, with the window closed, the room was very quiet. Location of the hotel was fabulous. Several nice cafes and bake shops just around the corner, also a Monoprix very close. Major Metro station (Montparnasse) is nearby, about a 3-minute walk, which makes travel a breeze. Staff very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice home base in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ManoaMom
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we loved the location, friendly staff, morning breakfast and tasteful decorations. Its proximity to the metro, public markets, nice restaurants was just what we were looking for. We would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Went with our 3 year old”
Reviews.Author: littlejet
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very nice. Internet communications with staff at the hotel were very good. We were able to make last minute changes to our reservations without problems by communicating via e-mail. Had to cancel one night without 24 hours notice and were only charged the room tax for that night. They were very accommodating in terms of helping us find a solution for bedding for our 3 year old. I don't know if all the rooms are now renovated, but the Internet picture of the room that had 3 beds showed a very outdated room. Given that we like a modern, minimalist room we definitely wanted a renovated room. We got a room (room 236, on third floor, facing "courtyard") that had 1 king bed. They were able to turn a chaise lounge in the room into a little bed for our three year old. The staff was incredibly friendly and nice. Their English is superb and that includes staff on duty at night (Bruce). The room was excellent. Yes, small, but well equipped with an excellent use of space. Flat screen TV mounted on wall (we brought a portable DVD player that we were able to hook into the hotel's TV to watch movies). Electronic safe in the closet. Two nice white fluffy robes in the closet. Bed extremely comfortable with warm duvet. The lighting in the room was very modern. One part of the room had small halogen bulbs each hanging by two angular wires from tracks on the ceiling. There was a small honor bar which we didn't use. Bathroom was very small. It had a decent built-in blow-dryer. Nice fluffy, white, high-quality towels. We were given lots more towels by the front desk when we asked. Lots of hot water, never ran out. Nice deep shower/tub which was great for soaking in at the end of the day. One problem - the shower did leak all over the floor so by the end of a day there were at least 1 or 2 soaking wet towels that we just laid on the corner of the floor by the toilet. Our three year old really liked it. It was cozy and he was able to be close to us. The staff were extremely friendly to him even though he was the only child we saw in the hotel the entire time. He loved the unique elevators, pressing the elevator buttons, and the small spiral staircase in the back of the hotel leading to our room. Another thing our three year old liked was the refreshments the hotel staff put out one night in the lobby. It was simple – juice, fresh fruit, chilled water, etc. Our son was very thirsty after a long walk around the Left Bank and he had 3 glasses of juice - the hotel staff didn’t bat an eye. We taught our son how to say simple things like “Bonjour Madame/Monsieur”, “Merci beaucoup”, and “sil vous plait” which I think helped. (As with any part of France, if you at least attempt the courtesy of greeting them in French, the people will be much more friendly and open than if you obnoxiously assume that they will just speak English.) One note: When we first arrived with all of our bags, both elevators were broken AND the stairwell leading to our room was being renovated. But the hotel staff handled it really well. The front desk guy had the workmen stop and he helped us carry our bags up three flights of stairs. The staircase renovation continued throughout our stay but was never loud. Also the workmen we saw were extremely nice. We never ate at the hotel. When you go straight out of the front door and turn left, there is a *great* café on the corner, named something like the Marquise Café. Great little place, very friendly staff. (Don’t miss the warm goat cheese salad!) The biggest drawback I found about this place was the location. Monparnasse seems kind of non-descript compared to the rest of Paris. I’ve enjoyed the locations of the other places I’ve stayed including the Latin Quarter, St. Germain de Pres, and the Opera area much better. Also, the Montparnasse train station is within walking distance to the hotel *if* you don’t have bags. However I would not recommend getting off at Montparnasse station (either from Metro, RER, or Air France bus) and expect to walk easily with a child to the hotel. Invest in a cab. It cost us about 12 euros as we were also charged for each bag. But it was money well spent. In summary, this hotel can’t be beat when it comes to friendliness. It was extremely child friendly and the room we stayed in was nicely decorated and updated. Biggest complaints were leaking shower and the blaise location in town. Unrelated to the hotel: Other things to do in Paris with a 3 year old… My husband took my son to the top of the Eiffel Tower which made a huge impression. He loved the elevator ride. Also at the base of the tower is a crepe stand and a carousel. He loved watching them make crepes and enjoyed eating them. He took two carousel rides and loved it. We had also planned to go to the Jardin d’Acclimation and the Cite de la Science (sp?) but didn’t have enough time as it was harder to overcome jet lag with our 3 year old. Right behind the Notre Dame cathedral is a delightful little park. It has a swing and an unusual thing we’d never seen. It was a disk that was about 1-2 feet off the ground and at an angle. It was about 6 feet in diameter and about 3 kids (or 1 adult and 1 kid) can get on it and lay flat on the disk. If someone else spins, then you go round and round while looking through the shady trees up above. Also did ice cream at Berthellion on the Ile de Paris. He loved the Metro, especially when the live musicians would board and play music, looking for a few euros. The portable DVD player **really** helped on the plane to keep him quiet and focused. It worked for about 3 hours. We also brought his kiddy roll-a-board with lots of sticker and coloring books, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Aviatic lived up to all the great reviews, I am very pleased”
Reviews.Author: rwchicago
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Paris was made even more enjoyable and memorable by my stay at the Aviatic St. Germain. My room was as nice as the pictures posted on the hotel's website: nicely decorated, clean and relaxing. It even smelled clean. Although the room was small, it was well designed and with the wooden floors, french windows that opened onto the street, and furniture with the right placement and proportions, it didn't feel at all claustrophobic. It had a great bathroom - sparkling clean and with plenty of hot water. The bed and linens were super comfy. My room faced onto the street, and there was a heavy drape that when drawn shut helped keep out all of the sounds of traffic. I loved opening the drape and the french windows in the morning and looking out at the street. The staff was very helpful and spoke good English while being tolerant of my halting French. Nicolas, Bruce, and Zhenyi in particular were friendly and responsive whenever I had a question or a request. I chose not to take advantage of the breakfast room, because I thought the cost was a little high. There are plenty of nice bakeries and cafes within easy walking distance. I confess, I sometimes went to a Starbucks nearby because I am addicted to a full cup of coffee in the morning. There are also a few fruit stands nearby where one could go for healthy snacks to balance out all the cheese and butter in the French diet. The hotel is only 1 hour from Charles DeGaulle airport by Metro and RER, it's a super easy ride. By the way, I recommend using the Saint Placide stop on the number 4 line Metro, it's slightly further away from the hotel than some of the other Metro stops but it's a lot less confusing. I did quite a lot of comparison shopping and one tip I have is to visit the Aviatic hotel's website -- I found the best pricing for my room that way.

Reviews.Title: “Can't do better”
Reviews.Author: 212NYC212
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Paris on several occasions for business and pleasure at high end properties and inexpensive boutique hotels, when I had money and when I had not. You cannot do better in terms of value for money, location, staff and the room. The room was spotless, has everything you need. The bed and linens and so comfortable you do not want to get out of them, the shower is so hot and powerful you do not wish to leave it either. The bath products provided smell so lovely. The staff is overly helpful and speak a multitude of languages. They let us into our room early after a long overnight flight from NYC. The location is super. Although not really in Saint Germain to me this is really Montparnarsse, it is only a short walk to Saint Germain and the Latin Quarter. Also Rue de Rennes is just down the street with great Paris retail shopping if your budget does not allow for Saint Germain shopping. At the end of a fun day in Paris all you want to do is take a long hot shower and get into a comfy luxury bed and this hotel delivers and then some and at under 150 Euros a night what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Charming home away from home in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: TampaHappytraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and felt welcomed and very comfortable. The rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. The location is close to many can't miss attractions and the staff is most amenable to directing you to the most direct public transportation to those that are a little farther away. Everyone was hospitable and efficient. The breakfast was delicious and in the evening we were pleasantly surprised to find an array of wine, beverages and snacks for our enjoyment. Would definitely recommend and return to this hotel. We were told there is another Aviatic Hotel that does not get good reviews. It is definitely not this one!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant professional staff, but rooms look much better on website!”
Reviews.Author: Emaxwell
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay in the Aviatic; I had booked a Superior room based on the website photos, but we were booked into room 134 which was right beside the lift, overlooking the road and quite shabby, I thought, with a stained carpet by the bathroom door. To the hotel's credit, when we asked for a different room we were given a much nicer deluxe room at the back. Like a lot of hotels in Paris, the entrance and reception areas are the smartest areas. I would rate them quite highly for moving us so professionally, but was surprised at the fact that the original room is a Superior, and can only imagine what a Traditional one is like. The area is good, with the rue du cherche midi nearby lovely for local shops and bistros.

Reviews.Title: “I could not have had a better stay!”
Reviews.Author: parisjetaime5
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I chose this hotel due to the great reviews we read and it's central location. It was even better than we expected! The location was perfect. It was close to multiple metro stations (3 minute easy walk), many great restaurants and any conveniences you need including no fee ATMs. In addition, the service was wonderful with a friendly and receptive staff. Each night the staff left out a bottle of red and white wine with complimentary glasses for guests, as well as peanuts, chocolates and other snacks. Complimentary! It was such a nice touch to this charming home away from home. The room was very comfortable and beautifully decorated, and it included a very nice TV. The water pressure in the shower was great, and the room cleanliness was superb. We also had an easy-to-use in room safe. As an even greater service, I unfortunately had left my coat there because the weather was so beautiful. I thought I would contact the staff to see if they could send it back to me, and they have been corresponding with me to make it work! All the details are settled and I'm expecting the coat very shortly. After everything, this was just the cherry on top. I can't recommend this hotel more. Paris was beautiful, and this hotel reflected all of the Parisian charm. Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but room disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Rookie73
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel, in a decent area (only a few minutes from Montparnasse, although this make it quite a walk from Saint-germain). Very friendly, helpful and courteous staff. The public areas are lovely - a delightful lounge at the front, and a quaint little garden. Our experience was somewhat let down by the 'superior' room - it was a decent size (esp for Paris), but remarkably spartan, with a stained carpet and grubby walls. It faced onto the main road (the courtyard-facing rooms may be a better option if the noise of late-night mopeds or early-morning commuters bothers you!), but, worse were the hotel's floodlights which were directly outside our windows, and thus brilliantly illuminated the room at night! The bed was at least very comfortable. Some of the other rooms seemed to have been modernised, and certainly the rooms on the upper floors (ie 3rd and above) won't be (as) affected by the floodlights, so I'd advise any travellers to bear this in mind when reserving.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CecileNetherlands
Reviews.Content: As we - my daughter and me - were looking for good value for money, we found this great hotel. Nice area, quiet location, and very relaxed atmosphere. I have been to many hotels in Paris before, and some of them much more expensive, but regarding the quality this one is the best. Very friendly staff, clean and nice room, and the breakfast was almost not-french: lots of fresh juices, different kinds of bread etc. A stay in this hotel will not be regretted.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - can't praise it enough”
Reviews.Author: DazOC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel Aviatic for one night in March 2009. We stayed on a recommendation. There seems to be some confusion on this review forum as there are 2 Hotel Aviatics in Paris. The one I am reviewing is the one on rue Vaugirard in the Montparnasse area. We arrived a bit early (1130) and weren't able to go to out room until 1400. This was probably the ONLY complaint I could have - but even then they do point this out to you on the website (i.e.check in after 1400). In any case the reception staff were very friendly and helpful and we left our bags and explored the local area. I spoke to the staff in French and so cannot comment on how helpful they would be in I had used English. We returned at 1400 and went to our room. It was really nice and a decent size considering we only spent 100 euro for the night. It was also spotlessly clean and a pretty nice design. There was a new TV with plenty channels and the bed was very comfortable. Note the stairs are quite steep - would be difficult with lots of luggage or kids etc. We were on the 4th floor which was a bit of a hike. I didn't see a lift. The hotel decor is very nice..we didn't have breakfast as there are lots of places in the surrounding area. So all in all a really good experience - lovely hotel and fantastic reception staff. Very much recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend - Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: rinaldi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in September and found it to be absolutly perfect. The rooms are clean, the hotel staff couldn't be more helpful and they speak very good english. The hotel is located just off Boulevard Montparnasse which has a great selection of eateries and the metro is also located here. There is also a supermarket just around the corner which was very handy for stocking up on bits and pieces. All in all I would highly recommend Hotel Aviatic and will return again when we next visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean hotel,with BEST STAFF ever!”
Reviews.Author: marithja
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a lovely romantic weekend getaway with my husband to Aviatic St. Germain in Paris. Booked through their website- fast and efficient, and got instant answer on my requests. They also helped me plan a suprise, and came with great suggestions, so I ended up suprising him with roses, champagne and chocolate, that was waiting for us in our room when we arrived- it was PERFECT. They also responded to my e-mails before departure on how to get there, weather, and everything else I mailed about.They even managed to write us a welcome note in Norwegian together with the roses and champagne! They went above and beyond! If you ask in the reseption they will help you to everything, the first night they sent us out to Restaurant Montparnasse 1900, and it was GREAT, like you stepped into the Art Deco age, with beautiful food-try it! The hotel is incredibly romantic,small and well kept.Very clean, and just beutiful decor! In a quiet street, but as you turn the corner you have acces to everything. Perfect location- just 5-20 minutes to walk to everything like Notre Dame, Louvre,Eiifel Tower etc...I loved to stay there, and will definetly go back and I reccomend it to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous staff and charming accomodations”
Reviews.Author: larosa46
Reviews.Content: just returned from 3 nights at the aviatic st. germain and had a wonderful time there. Paulo and Bruce were so kind and helpful to us with everything. they gave perfect directions, restaurant suggestions, and were able to have our room ready upon arrival when we were so exhausted from our trip. this alone was a wonderful help to getting started on our 2 week excursion in europe. the location is lovely and convenient to many metro stops and centrally located for walking all over the city, which we did!. we finally figured the best metro stop out when we were ready to leave! the hotel is situated in a quiet neighborhood but not in the hub bub or st. michel area. the room was lovely and charming but tiny for the 3 of us. bathroom also tiny and only a hand held shower/tub. very clean and breakfast was delicious. i would rate the hotel avaiatic st. germain with high marks and would definately recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent stay”
Reviews.Author: ricardopedreschi
Reviews.Content: Excelent stay, the Hotel is clean, sofisticated and the staff, especilly Mademoisele Marylin and Mrs Paulo, are very interested and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Highbury58
Reviews.Content: I was expecting to stay in a hot, overly heated cupboard like my last experience of Paris but this hotel was none of these! The staff were very friendly and coped with my dreadful French, the rooms were quite large, well appointed, the bathroom large and clean and the breakfast room atmospheric and the food provided for many tastes. My only niggles were the expensive access to the internet and the lack of knowledge of celiac disease, but these are common to all France not this hotel especially. Thanks for the great stay

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Love2CWorld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a nice and quiet 3-night stay at Aviatic. It's a very cute French hotel. The room was small like hotels in NY, but it was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was nice and new, and they provided L'Occitane shampoo and bath wash, which was nice. Only downside is that water drain was a bit slow like many hotels internationally. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful, and can speak English well. It's located near a main metro station Monteparnasse, so it's convenient to get around. There's also a local market called Monop near the metro station to stock up on food and drinks if you're traveling on a budget. The booking is easy through the hotel website, and they offered a good deal. :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aviatic”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGirl5
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aviatic St Germaine is lovely and the staff is wonderful. I only stayed one night, but if I return to Paris I will stay at this hotel my entire trip. There is a metro stop within four minutes and plenty of restaurants and shopping within five minutes. My room was very nice and I am extremely picky. The decor was very nice, the bed was comfortable and the deep soaking tub came in handy after walking in Paris. There is complimentary wine and snacks in the evenings, which was also a nice touch. Paulo and the rest of the staff were very kind and patient with all of my questions. Stay at the Hotel Aviatic St Germaine and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “what a lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Tita2008
Reviews.Content: we have just arrived from 3 nigth stay at The Aviatic St Germain, on rue de Vaugirard. It is a very charming hotel, with a very kind staff , very clean and with a lovely decor and a very good location, the situation is wonderful because is walking distance of rue de rennes and blvd st germain and also of boulevard montparnasse with many shops,and restaurants nearby . But the most important thing to share with travellers is: the bread is marvellous....I ate so much ...unforgetable!!!!!!I had a wonderful stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint neighborhood Flair”
Reviews.Author: Bostongal94
Reviews.Content: This is a cute and charming hotel. The lobby is beautiful and the front desk people were very nice. We loved the night clerk, he was so helpful with getting our infant daughter to the childrens ER for a high fever (his names escapes me now). It is located right off the main street in Montparnasse in the 6th arrondisement. We walked to the corner cafe for breakfast every morning. We spent one day walking from our hotel to St. Sulpice then the Jardin du Luxembourg, then the Pantheon and finally Notre Dame and the Louvre. It took all day because we had a 5year old and an infant in the stroller but it was warm and sunny and we spent hours at the playground in the Luxembourg Gardens. The hotel was clean especially the bathrooms sparkled. The bedrooms were clean but could use an update ie bedspreads and carpet were worn looking. Myself and my husband and infant daughter stayed in one room for $179(superior) and my mom and 5 year old in the room across the hall for $149. One is just slightly bigger to fit a pack and play for the baby. The base of which was slightly weak and left the mattress unlevel. She ended up sleeping with us however, the King sized bed is two twins put together. She did not fall through, thank goodness. It was nice because we were the only people on that floor (two rooms to a floor in the back section of the hotel which is elevator accessible. I think the front of the hotel you need to take the stairs. Overall, we liked the hotel and would recommend it to our friends. Parking is directly across the street, you have to open a big gate and then drive down a narrow alley and then open up the manual garage door and try to squeeze your car (we had a European SUV, a VW Touran,a stick shift),into the tiny space. It was a challenge since we arrived at night. But nice that it was so close, we kept our car there for three days and walked and took the metro and buses to get around. We did walk halfway to the Eiffel tower down Montparnasse Blvd going west at night. It was beautiful to see the Eiffel Tower light up in blue light. Since I was wearing heels on my way to dinner, we took the Metro the rest of the way. I felt safe even at Midnight riding the metro with my husband (we are in our mid 30's). Beware, there are two hotels with very similar names. One is Aviatic Hotel (6th arrondisement, and 3 or 4 stars), the other is Hotel Aviatic (only one star, not nearly as nice) in the 14th arrondisement if I remember. This may account for some of the reservation confusion written in other reviews. When booking please note the correct address 105 rue de Vaugirad!!

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireKaroo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay in Paris at the Hotel Aviatic, on the rue de Vaugirard. Previously we stayed at the Holiday Inn further up the same road but found the Aviatic much superior in many ways. The staff were very helpful in all manners (except one experience when we had to persevere to get a jug of VERY hot water) booking tours and transfers. The breakfasts are fresh and filling but repetitive ,served in a tiny breakfast room. It is full of charm and character. We stayed in a double deluxe room on the 6th floor which was small but very well appointed.The bed was extremely comfortable after pounding the pavements of Paris all day long. The hotel is located about 10-15 minutes walk from two different Metro stations so very conveniently placed to get to all the famous Parisian sights. There are some good restauarants and brasseries nearby , but our 5* favourite was the Restaurant Rousseau on the Rue the Cherche Midi. They serve some splendid food, good wines and desserts to die for - about 15 minutes from the Aviatic. All in all, a very memorable experience which we would gladly repeat, and our thanks go to the hotel staff for makingour stay a very enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Aviatic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: csinohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aviatic Hotel in Paris for 2 nights and loved it! It was our first time to Paris so we relied on TripAdvisor and guide books. Not much was said about this hotel in the books so I wanted to share our experience. It was very richly decorated and our newly renovated room was tasteful and very clean. It was small but we expected that. It is located in the 6th and we were abe to walk everywhere. It is only a 5 minute walk from Gare Montparnesse bus terminal (we took the Air France bus from CDG Airport). Fromt he hotel we walked to the Eiffel Tower, across the Seine to the right bank and back. We were in walking distance to St. Germain which had good restaurants and lively night life. We loved it and would recommend it to anyone looking for a small, clean, tasteful hotel. For only 160 euros per night we thought it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: RedStripeOntario
Reviews.Content: Two couples (mid 50s) in Paris for first time. Great room, staff very helpful and friendly. Their English was excellent. Rooms extremely clean and non smoking. The king size bed was a surprise. Our rooms faced the inner courtyard and it was so peaceful at night. A little bit further to walk to the Seine than I anticipated but the weather was great and the transportation system very good. The breakfast was excellent - the coffee machine offered cappuccinos, American coffee,cafe latte etc and you could help yourself as much as you wanted to the buffet and refreshments. Great start to the day - you didn't need lunch. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for your money”
Reviews.Author: Giacomo V
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife took a breack last 19 September for 3 nights at this hotel. Convenientely located ( also if not so close to the Luxembourg gardens ) just in walking distance from the metro line 4, is a small historic hotel with a family target clientele. Our room on the 3 floor was a superior room with a good bathroom but the bed wasn't a queen bed but two single paired bed. Room was a little small but perfect for Paris standard bedroom size, it was the number 315 just close top the elevator with a sad inside view. Was very clean and with a good closet. Breackfast is also a good value for money at 14€. Overall if it fits your budget is a wise choice.

Reviews.Title: “superior room!”
Reviews.Author: d.poirier
Reviews.Content: went to france for 11 days, stayed in 5 different hotels and this was the most disapointing one. we had booked a superior room.it was small but that i dont mind, the decoration is long over due and it is not central to my standard being close to the montparnasse railway station so far from the seine. after reading the reviews it feel like i was in a different hotel but no the pictures prove that i am talking about the same one! would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Aviatic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MollyMexico
Reviews.Content: After a long trip, from Mexico, I arrived to the Aviatic Hotel, located at Rue Vaugirard. It was wonderful to enter to the room an see a very confortable bed, a clean and spacious bathroom. This is an amaizing hotel, with TV via satelite, internet conexion, they offer a delicious breakfast. One important issue for me was the kindness of all the staff and the owner of the hotel, incredible! they made me feel really at home. I have no doubt to repit the experience to stay at Aviatic and I´m very confortable to recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the staff”
Reviews.Author: Ledariodejaneiro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, the rooms are very nice and clean and the staff makes you feel welcomed . They have a very good breakfast . I will go there again because I felt at home at the Aviatic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: onewetdog
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights in the beautiful hotel. We had our family of 5 with two connecting rooms and we were all very comfortable. The hotel is perfect for families and for couples looking for a fabulous place to stay. The hotel is perfectly situated in town - we were able to walk or take the Metro everywhere we wanted to go! We would stay at this hotel over and over!

Reviews.Title: “Aviatic Hotel Saint Germain is a real standout!!”
Reviews.Author: fabricef
Reviews.Content: I took the family to Paris summer 2007 and we stayed at the Aviatic Hotel Saint Germain for a week in late August. We positively loved the place! We had 2 adjoining rooms on the top floor. The layout was great as it gave the adults and the kids the space we needed. The rooms were spacious, comfortable, and tastefully decorated. The beds were super comfortable and the rooms were quiet at night, something my wife and I value greatly. Staff was friendly and helpful, and we loved the breakfast. Last but not least, the price was affordable, in spite of a strong Euro. Two thumds up to great, centrally located hotel when visiting one of the coolest cities in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: tross30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an awesome spot especially if you love to explore. The room we had was exactly as shown on the website and bathroom was nice and large. The rooms will always be small in Paris and as we spent most of our time exploring the bed was just perfect to come home to after the days acitivities. The metro is only just up or down the road however it is an easy walk to most tourist attractions. The local eateries also cater to the english speaking tourist quite well (helps to no a little french of course this is paris!!). My wife was also pleased to have some shopping alternatives close by with some chain stores and smaller boutiques all within 500m. We caught the Air France shuttle bus from Orly into Montparnasse and only a 5 minute walk to the hotel. So either by train or bus the airports are easliy accessed. Overall a great spot great price (for Paris) and well worth a visit. We stayed for 6 nights and did not encounter any problems with the staff always happy to help where they could. Would we go back ? Yes and also recommend it !!
